2341  ni_retcode_t retval = NI_RETCODE_SUCCESS;
2342  uint32_t buffer_size = 0;
2343  ni_xcoder_params_t *p_param;
2344  void *p_buffer = NULL;
2345  ni_instance_buf_info_t buf_info = {0};
2346  uint32_t ui32LBA = 0;
2347  uint32_t max_cu_size;
2348  uint32_t block_size;
2349  int32_t width, height;
2350  int m_threshold = 0;
2351 
2352  if (!p_ctx || !p_ctx->p_session_config)
2353  {
2354  ni_log(NI_LOG_ERROR, "ERROR: %s() passed parameters are null!, return\n",
2355  __func__);
2356  retval = NI_RETCODE_INVALID_PARAM;
2357  LRETURN;
2358  }
2359 
2360  p_param = (ni_xcoder_params_t *)p_ctx->p_session_config;
2361  ni_log(NI_LOG_TRACE, "%s(): enter hwframes = %d\n", __func__,
2362  p_param->hwframes);
2363 
2364  // calculate encoder ROI map size: each QP info takes 8-bit, represent 8 x 8
2365  // pixel block
2366  max_cu_size = (NI_CODEC_FORMAT_H264 == p_ctx->codec_format) ? 16 : 64;
2367 
2368  width = p_param->source_width;
2369  height = p_param->source_height;
2370  // AV1 non-8x8-aligned resolution is implicitly cropped due to Quadra HW limitation
2371  if (NI_CODEC_FORMAT_AV1 == p_ctx->codec_format)
2372  {
2373  width = (width / 8) * 8;
2374  height = (height / 8) * 8;
2375  }
2376 
2377  block_size =
2378  ((width + max_cu_size - 1) & (~(max_cu_size - 1))) *
2379  ((height + max_cu_size - 1) & (~(max_cu_size - 1))) /
2380  (8 * 8);
2381  p_ctx->roi_len = ((block_size + 63) & (~63)); // align to 64 bytes
2382 
2383  ni_log(NI_LOG_DEBUG, "%s(): finish init\n", __func__);
2384 
2385  //Check if there is an instance or we need a new one
2386  if (NI_INVALID_SESSION_ID == p_ctx->session_id)
2387  {
2388  p_ctx->device_type = NI_DEVICE_TYPE_ENCODER;
2389  p_ctx->pts_table = NULL;
2390  p_ctx->dts_queue = NULL;
2391  p_ctx->buffer_pool = NULL;
2392  p_ctx->status = 0;
2393  p_ctx->key_frame_type = 0;
2394  p_ctx->keyframe_factor = 1;
2395  p_ctx->frame_num = 0;
2396  p_ctx->pkt_num = 0;
2397  p_ctx->rc_error_count = 0;
2398  p_ctx->force_frame_type = 0;
2399  p_ctx->ready_to_close = 0;
2400  p_ctx->auto_dl_handle = 0;
2401  //Sequence change tracking reated stuff
2402  p_ctx->active_video_width = 0;
2403  p_ctx->active_video_height = 0;
2404  p_ctx->p_all_zero_buf = NULL;
2405  p_ctx->actual_video_width = 0;
2406  p_ctx->enc_pts_w_idx = 0;
2407  p_ctx->enc_pts_r_idx = 0;
2408  p_ctx->session_run_state = SESSION_RUN_STATE_NORMAL;
2409  p_ctx->session_timestamp = 0;
2410  memset(p_ctx->pkt_custom_sei_set, 0, NI_FIFO_SZ * sizeof(ni_custom_sei_set_t *));
2411  memset(&(p_ctx->param_err_msg[0]), 0, sizeof(p_ctx->param_err_msg));
2412 
2413  //malloc zero data buffer
2414  if (ni_posix_memalign(&p_ctx->p_all_zero_buf, sysconf(_SC_PAGESIZE),
2415  NI_DATA_BUFFER_LEN))
2416  {
2417  ni_log(NI_LOG_ERROR, "ERROR %d: %s() alloc all zero buffer failed\n",
2418  NI_ERRNO, __func__);
2419  retval = NI_RETCODE_ERROR_MEM_ALOC;
2420  LRETURN;
2421  }
2422  memset(p_ctx->p_all_zero_buf, 0, NI_DATA_BUFFER_LEN);
2423 
2424  //malloc data buffer
2425  if (ni_posix_memalign(&p_buffer, sysconf(_SC_PAGESIZE), NI_DATA_BUFFER_LEN))
2426  {
2427  ni_log(NI_LOG_ERROR, "ERROR %d: %s() alloc data buffer failed\n",
2428  __func__, NI_ERRNO);
2429  ni_aligned_free(p_ctx->p_all_zero_buf);
2430  retval = NI_RETCODE_ERROR_MEM_ALOC;
2431  LRETURN;
2432  }
2433  memset(p_buffer, 0, NI_DATA_BUFFER_LEN);
2434 
2435  //Set session ID to be invalid. In case we cannot open session, the session id wold remain invalid.
2436  //In case we can open sesison, the session id would become valid.
2437  ((ni_session_stats_t *)p_buffer)->ui16SessionId =
2438  (uint16_t)NI_INVALID_SESSION_ID;
2439 
2440  // First uint32_t is either an invaild session ID or a valid session ID, depending on if session could be opened
2441  ui32LBA = OPEN_SESSION_CODEC(NI_DEVICE_TYPE_ENCODER,
2442  ni_htonl(p_ctx->codec_format), 0);
2443  ni_nvme_send_read_cmd(p_ctx->blk_io_handle, p_ctx->event_handle, p_buffer,
2444  NI_DATA_BUFFER_LEN, ui32LBA);
2445  //Open will return a session status structure with a valid session id if it worked.
2446  //Otherwise the invalid session id set before the open command will stay
2447  p_ctx->session_id =
2448  ni_ntohs(((ni_session_stats_t *)p_buffer)->ui16SessionId);
2449  p_ctx->session_timestamp =
2450  ni_htonll(((ni_session_stats_t *)p_buffer)->ui64Session_timestamp);
2451  if (NI_INVALID_SESSION_ID == p_ctx->session_id)
2452  {
2453  ni_log(NI_LOG_ERROR,
2454  "ERROR %s(): p_ctx->device_handle=%" PRIx64 ", "
2455  "p_ctx->hw_id=%d, p_ctx->session_id=%d\n",
2456  __func__, (int64_t)p_ctx->device_handle, p_ctx->hw_id,
2457  p_ctx->session_id);
2458  ni_encoder_session_close(p_ctx, 0);
2459  retval = NI_RETCODE_ERROR_INVALID_SESSION;
2460  LRETURN;
2461  }
2462  ni_log(NI_LOG_DEBUG, "Encoder open session ID:0x%x timestamp:%" PRIu64 "\n",
2463  p_ctx->session_id, p_ctx->session_timestamp);
2464 
2465  //Send keep alive timeout Info
2466  uint64_t keep_alive_timeout =
2467  p_ctx->keep_alive_timeout * 1000000; //send us to FW
2468  memset(p_buffer, 0, NI_DATA_BUFFER_LEN);
2469  memcpy(p_buffer, &keep_alive_timeout, sizeof(keep_alive_timeout));
2470  ni_log(NI_LOG_DEBUG, "%s keep_alive_timeout %" PRIx64 "\n", __func__,
2471  keep_alive_timeout);
2472  ui32LBA = CONFIG_SESSION_KeepAliveTimeout_W(p_ctx->session_id);
2473  retval = ni_nvme_send_write_cmd(p_ctx->blk_io_handle, p_ctx->event_handle,
2474  p_buffer, NI_DATA_BUFFER_LEN, ui32LBA);
2475  CHECK_ERR_RC(p_ctx, retval, nvme_admin_cmd_xcoder_config, p_ctx->device_type,
2476  p_ctx->hw_id, &(p_ctx->session_id));
2477  CHECK_VPU_RECOVERY(retval);
2478 
2479  if (NI_RETCODE_SUCCESS != retval)
2480  {
2481  ni_log(NI_LOG_ERROR,
2482  "ERROR %s(): nvme write keep_alive_timeout command "
2483  "failed, blk_io_handle: %" PRIx64 ", hw_id, %d\n",
2484  __func__, (int64_t)p_ctx->blk_io_handle, p_ctx->hw_id);
2485  retval = NI_RETCODE_ERROR_NVME_CMD_FAILED;
2486  LRETURN;
2487  }
2488 
2489  // Send SW version to FW if FW version is higher than major 6 minor 1
2490  if (is_fw_rev_higher(p_ctx, (uint8_t)'6', (uint8_t)'1'))
2491  {
2492  // Send SW version to session manager
2493  memset(p_buffer, 0, NI_DATA_BUFFER_LEN);
2494  memcpy(p_buffer, NI_XCODER_REVISION, sizeof(uint64_t));
2495  ni_log(NI_LOG_DEBUG, "%s sw_version major %c minor %c fw_rev major %c minor %c\n", __func__,
2496  NI_XCODER_REVISION[NI_XCODER_REVISION_API_MAJOR_VER_IDX],
2497  NI_XCODER_REVISION[NI_XCODER_REVISION_API_MINOR_VER_IDX],
2498  p_ctx->fw_rev[NI_XCODER_REVISION_API_MAJOR_VER_IDX],
2499  p_ctx->fw_rev[NI_XCODER_REVISION_API_MINOR_VER_IDX]);
2500  ui32LBA = CONFIG_SESSION_SWVersion_W(p_ctx->session_id);
2501  retval = ni_nvme_send_write_cmd(p_ctx->blk_io_handle, p_ctx->event_handle,
2502  p_buffer, NI_DATA_BUFFER_LEN, ui32LBA);
2503  CHECK_ERR_RC(p_ctx, retval, nvme_admin_cmd_xcoder_config, p_ctx->device_type,
2504  p_ctx->hw_id, &(p_ctx->session_id));
2505  CHECK_VPU_RECOVERY(retval);
2506 
2507  if (NI_RETCODE_SUCCESS != retval)
2508  {
2509  ni_log(NI_LOG_ERROR,
2510  "ERROR %s(): nvme write sw_version command "
2511  "failed, blk_io_handle: %" PRIx64 ", hw_id, %d\n",
2512  __func__, (int64_t)p_ctx->blk_io_handle, p_ctx->hw_id);
2513  retval = NI_RETCODE_ERROR_NVME_CMD_FAILED;
2514  LRETURN;
2515  }
2516 
2517  // For FW rev 61 or newer, initialize with the most current size
2518  p_ctx->meta_size = sizeof(ni_metadata_enc_bstream_t);
2519  }
2520  else
2521  {
2522  // For FW rev 60 or older, initialize with metadata size 32
2523  p_ctx->meta_size = NI_FW_ENC_BITSTREAM_META_DATA_SIZE;
2524  }
2525 
2526  ni_log(NI_LOG_DEBUG, "Open session completed\n");
2527  }
2528 
2529  /* Modify mmap_threshold and trim_threshold of malloc */
2530  // calculate the default threshold which equals to the resolution + padding size.
2531  // 64 is AV_INPUT_BUFFER_PADDING_SIZE
2532  m_threshold = p_param->source_width * p_param->source_height * 3 / 2 *
2533  p_ctx->bit_depth_factor + 64;
2534  m_threshold = ((m_threshold + (NI_MEM_PAGE_ALIGNMENT - 1)) /
2535  NI_MEM_PAGE_ALIGNMENT) * NI_MEM_PAGE_ALIGNMENT;
2536 
2537  // The upper limit is DEFAULT_MMAP_THRESHOLD_MAX: 512*1024 on 32-bit systems,
2538  // or 4*1024*1024*sizeof(long) on 64-bit systems.
2539  // This macro is not defined in header file.
2540  // So, assume that is running on 64-bit systems
2541  if (m_threshold > 4 * 1024 * 1024 * sizeof(long))
2542  {
2543  ni_log(NI_LOG_INFO, "Warning: m_threshold (%d) is bigger than "
2544  "DEFAULT_MMAP_THRESHOLD_MAX, use default value (%d)\n",
2545  m_threshold, 4 * 1024 * 1024 * sizeof(long));
2546  m_threshold = 4 * 1024 * 1024 * sizeof(long);
2547  }
2548 
2549  if (p_param->staticMmapThreshold) // Set Static Mmap Threshold
2550  {
2551 #if defined(__linux__) && !defined(_ANDROID)
2552  // If the malloc buffer is larger than the threshold,
2553  // glibc will use mmap to malloc the memory, which is a low speed method.
2554  // So, set the M_MMAP_THRESHOLD >= 1 yuv buffer size here.
2555  if (mallopt(M_MMAP_THRESHOLD, m_threshold) == 0)
2556  {
2557  ni_log(NI_LOG_ERROR, "Error: could not set M_MMAP_THRESHOLD to %d\n",
2558  m_threshold);
2559  retval = NI_RETCODE_ERROR_MEM_ALOC;
2560  LRETURN;
2561  }
2562 
2563  // When the amount of contiguous free memory at the top of the heap
2564  // grows larger than M_TRIM_THRESHOLD,
2565  // free(3) employs sbrk(2) to release this memory back to the system.
2566  // So, set the M_TRIM_THRESHOLD to 3*m_threshold,
2567  // to avoid an inefficient case, frequently releasing and requesting physical memory.
2568  if (mallopt(M_TRIM_THRESHOLD, 3 * m_threshold) == 0)
2569  {
2570  ni_log(NI_LOG_ERROR, "Error: could not set M_TRIM_THRESHOLD to %ds\n",
2571  3 * m_threshold);
2572  retval = NI_RETCODE_ERROR_MEM_ALOC;
2573  LRETURN;
2574  }
2575 #else
2576  ni_log(NI_LOG_INFO,
2577  "Warning: this platform does not support staticMmapThreshold\n");
2578 #endif
2579  }
2580  else // default
2581  {
2582  // a way to dynamically trigger a pre-mature increase in mmap&trim threshold
2583  // make the mmap_threshold larger than frame size to avoid frequent page faults
2584  m_threshold = (int) (m_threshold * 1.25); // An experience value
2585  void *temp_buf = malloc((size_t) m_threshold);
2586  ni_log(NI_LOG_TRACE, "trigger a pre-mature increase in mmap&trim threshold: 0x%p = malloc(%d)\n",
2587  temp_buf, m_threshold);
2588  free(temp_buf);
2589  }
2590 
2591  if (p_ctx->hw_action == NI_CODEC_HW_ENABLE)
2592  {
2593  ni_device_capability_t sender_cap, receiver_cap;
2594 
2595  retval = ni_device_capability_query(p_ctx->sender_handle, &sender_cap);
2596  if (retval != NI_RETCODE_SUCCESS)
2597  {
2598  ni_log(NI_LOG_ERROR, "ERROR: ni_device_capability_query returned %d\n",
2599  retval);
2600  LRETURN;
2601  }
2602 
2603  retval = ni_device_capability_query(p_ctx->blk_io_handle, &receiver_cap);
2604 
2605  if (retval != NI_RETCODE_SUCCESS)
2606  {
2607  ni_log(NI_LOG_ERROR, "ERROR: ni_device_capability_query returned %d\n",
2608  retval);
2609  LRETURN;
2610  }
2611 
2612  for (uint8_t ui8Index = 0; ui8Index < 20; ui8Index++)
2613  {
2614  if (sender_cap.serial_number[ui8Index] !=
2615  receiver_cap.serial_number[ui8Index])
2616  {
2617  // QDFW-315 Autodownload
2618  p_ctx->auto_dl_handle = p_ctx->sender_handle;
2619  ni_log(NI_LOG_DEBUG, "Autodownload device handle set %p!\n",
2620  p_ctx->auto_dl_handle);
2621  p_ctx->hw_action = NI_CODEC_HW_NONE;
2622  break;
2623  }
2624  }
2625  }
2626 
2627  retval = ni_config_instance_set_encoder_params(p_ctx);
2628  if (NI_RETCODE_SUCCESS != retval)
2629  {
2630  ni_log(NI_LOG_ERROR, "ERROR: calling ni_config_instance_set_encoder_params(): "
2631  "p_ctx->device_handle=%" PRIx64 ", p_ctx->hw_id=%d, p_ctx->session_id=%d\n",
2632  (int64_t)p_ctx->device_handle, p_ctx->hw_id, p_ctx->session_id);
2633  ni_encoder_session_close(p_ctx, 0);
2634  retval = NI_RETCODE_ERROR_INVALID_SESSION;
2635  LRETURN;
2636  }
2637 
2638  ni_timestamp_init(p_ctx, &p_ctx->pts_table, "enc_pts");
2639  ni_timestamp_init(p_ctx, &p_ctx->dts_queue, "enc_dts");
2640 
2641  // init close caption SEI header and trailer
2642  memcpy(p_ctx->itu_t_t35_cc_sei_hdr_hevc, g_itu_t_t35_cc_sei_hdr_hevc,
2643  NI_CC_SEI_HDR_HEVC_LEN);
2644  memcpy(p_ctx->itu_t_t35_cc_sei_hdr_h264, g_itu_t_t35_cc_sei_hdr_h264,
2645  NI_CC_SEI_HDR_H264_LEN);
2646  memcpy(p_ctx->sei_trailer, g_sei_trailer, NI_CC_SEI_TRAILER_LEN);
2647  // init hdr10+ SEI header
2648  memcpy(p_ctx->itu_t_t35_hdr10p_sei_hdr_hevc, g_itu_t_t35_hdr10p_sei_hdr_hevc,
2649  NI_HDR10P_SEI_HDR_HEVC_LEN);
2650  memcpy(p_ctx->itu_t_t35_hdr10p_sei_hdr_h264, g_itu_t_t35_hdr10p_sei_hdr_h264,
2651  NI_HDR10P_SEI_HDR_H264_LEN);
2652 
2653  // query to check the final encoder config status
2654  for (;;)
2655  {
2656  retval = ni_query_instance_buf_info(p_ctx, INST_BUF_INFO_RW_WRITE,
2657  NI_DEVICE_TYPE_ENCODER, &buf_info);
2658 
2659  CHECK_ERR_RC(p_ctx, retval, nvme_admin_cmd_xcoder_config,
2660  p_ctx->device_type, p_ctx->hw_id,
2661  &(p_ctx->session_id));
2662 
2663  if (NI_RETCODE_NVME_SC_VPU_RSRC_INSUFFICIENT == retval)
2664  {
2665  ni_log(NI_LOG_ERROR, "ERROR: VPU_RSRC_INSUFFICIENT\n");
2666  LRETURN;
2667  }
2668  else if (buf_info.buf_avail_size > 0)
2669  {
2670  ni_log(NI_LOG_DEBUG, "%s(): buf_avail_size %u\n", __func__,
2671  buf_info.buf_avail_size);
2672  break;
2673  }
2674  else
2675  {
2676  ni_usleep(1000);
2677  }
2678  }
2679 
2680  ni_log(NI_LOG_DEBUG,
2681  "%s(): p_ctx->device_handle=%" PRIx64 ", p_ctx->hw_id=%d, "
2682  "p_ctx->session_id=%d\n",
2683  __func__, (int64_t)p_ctx->device_handle, p_ctx->hw_id,
2684  p_ctx->session_id);
2685 
2686 #ifdef XCODER_DUMP_DATA
2687  char dir_name[256] = {0};
2688  snprintf(dir_name, sizeof(dir_name), "%ld-%u-enc-pkt", (long)getpid(),
2689  p_ctx->session_id);
2690  DIR *dir = opendir(dir_name);
2691  if (!dir && ENOENT == NI_ERRNO)
2692  {
2693  mkdir(dir_name, S_IRWXU | S_IRWXG | S_IRWXO);
2694  ni_log(NI_LOG_DEBUG, "Encoder pkt dump dir created: %s\n", dir_name);
2695  }
2696 
2697  snprintf(dir_name, sizeof(dir_name), "%ld-%u-enc-fme", (long)getpid(),
2698  p_ctx->session_id);
2699  dir = opendir(dir_name);
2700  if (!dir && ENOENT == NI_ERRNO)
2701  {
2702  mkdir(dir_name, S_IRWXU | S_IRWXG | S_IRWXO);
2703  ni_log(NI_LOG_DEBUG, "Encoder frame dump dir created: %s\n", dir_name);
2704  }
2705 #endif
2706 
2707 END:
2708 
2709  ni_aligned_free(p_buffer);
2710  ni_log(NI_LOG_TRACE, "%s(): exit\n", __func__);
2711 
2712  return retval;
2713 }
2714 
2715 /*!******************************************************************************
2716  * \brief Flush encoder output
2717  *
2718  * \param
2719  *
2720  * \return
2721  *******************************************************************************/
2722 ni_retcode_t ni_encoder_session_flush(ni_session_context_t* p_ctx)
2723 {
2724  ni_retcode_t retval;
2725  ni_log(NI_LOG_TRACE, "%s(): enter\n", __func__);
2726  if (!p_ctx)
2727  {
2728  ni_log(NI_LOG_ERROR, "ERROR: %s() passed parameters are null!, return\n",
2729  __func__);
2730  retval = NI_RETCODE_INVALID_PARAM;
2731  LRETURN;
2732  }
2733 
2734  if (NI_INVALID_SESSION_ID == p_ctx->session_id)
2735  {
2736  ni_log(NI_LOG_ERROR, "ERROR %s(): Invalid session ID, return.\n",
2737  __func__);
2738  retval = NI_RETCODE_ERROR_INVALID_SESSION;
2739  LRETURN;
2740  }
2741 
2742  retval = ni_config_instance_eos(p_ctx, NI_DEVICE_TYPE_ENCODER);
2743  CHECK_ERR_RC(p_ctx, retval, nvme_admin_cmd_xcoder_config,
2744  p_ctx->device_type, p_ctx->hw_id,
2745  &(p_ctx->session_id));
2746  CHECK_VPU_RECOVERY(retval);
2747 
2748  if(NI_RETCODE_SUCCESS != retval)
2749  {
2750  ni_log(NI_LOG_ERROR, "ERROR: %s(), return\n", __func__);
2751  }
2752 
2753 END:
2754 
2755  ni_log(NI_LOG_TRACE, "%s(): success exit\n", __func__);
2756  return retval;
2757 }
2758 
2759 /*!******************************************************************************
2760  * \brief Close a xcoder encoder instance
2761  *
2762  * \param
2763  *
2764  * \return
2765  *******************************************************************************/
2766 ni_retcode_t ni_encoder_session_close(ni_session_context_t* p_ctx, int eos_recieved)
2767 {
2768  ni_retcode_t retval = NI_RETCODE_SUCCESS;
2769  void* p_buffer = NULL;
2770  uint32_t ui32LBA = 0;
2771  int counter = 0;
2772  int ret = 0;
2773 
2774  ni_log(NI_LOG_TRACE, "%s(): enter\n", __func__);
2775 
2776  if (!p_ctx)
2777  {
2778  ni_log(NI_LOG_ERROR, "ERROR: %s() passed parameters are null!, return\n",
2779  __func__);
2780  return NI_RETCODE_INVALID_PARAM;
2781  }
2782 
2783  ni_pthread_mutex_lock(&p_ctx->mutex);
2784 
2785  if (NI_INVALID_SESSION_ID == p_ctx->session_id)
2786  {
2787  ni_log(NI_LOG_TRACE, "%s(): Invalid session ID, return.\n", __func__);
2788  retval = NI_RETCODE_SUCCESS;
2789  LRETURN;
2790  }
2791 
2792  ni_log(NI_LOG_INFO,
2793  "Encoder_complete_info:session_id 0x%x, total frames input:%u "
2794  "buffered: %u completed: %u output: %u dropped: %u\n",
2795  p_ctx->session_id, p_ctx->session_statistic.ui32FramesInput,
2796  p_ctx->session_statistic.ui32FramesBuffered,
2797  p_ctx->session_statistic.ui32FramesCompleted,
2798  p_ctx->session_statistic.ui32FramesOutput,
2799  p_ctx->session_statistic.ui32FramesDropped);
2800 
2801  //malloc data buffer
2802  if (ni_posix_memalign(&p_buffer, sysconf(_SC_PAGESIZE), NI_DATA_BUFFER_LEN))
2803  {
2804  ni_log(NI_LOG_ERROR, "ERROR %d: %s() alloc data buffer failed\n",
2805  NI_ERRNO, __func__);
2806  retval = NI_RETCODE_ERROR_MEM_ALOC;
2807  LRETURN;
2808  }
2809  memset(p_buffer, 0, NI_DATA_BUFFER_LEN);
2810 
2811  ui32LBA = CLOSE_SESSION_R(p_ctx->session_id, NI_DEVICE_TYPE_ENCODER);
2812 
2813  int retry = 0;
2814  while (retry < NI_SESSION_CLOSE_RETRY_MAX)
2815  {
2816  ni_log(NI_LOG_DEBUG,
2817  "%s(): p_ctx->blk_io_handle=%" PRIx64 ", p_ctx->hw_id=%d, "
2818  "p_ctx->session_id=%d, close_mode=1\n",
2819  __func__, (int64_t)p_ctx->blk_io_handle, p_ctx->hw_id,
2820  p_ctx->session_id);
2821 
2822  if (ni_nvme_send_read_cmd(p_ctx->blk_io_handle, p_ctx->event_handle,
2823  p_buffer, NI_DATA_BUFFER_LEN, ui32LBA) < 0)
2824  {
2825  ni_log(NI_LOG_ERROR, "ERROR %s(): command failed\n", __func__);
2826  retval = NI_RETCODE_ERROR_NVME_CMD_FAILED;
2827  break;
2828  } else
2829  {
2830  //Close should always succeed
2831  retval = NI_RETCODE_SUCCESS;
2832  p_ctx->session_id = NI_INVALID_SESSION_ID;
2833  break;
2834  }
2835  /*
2836  else if(((ni_session_closed_status_t *)p_buffer)->session_closed)
2837  {
2838  retval = NI_RETCODE_SUCCESS;
2839  p_ctx->session_id = NI_INVALID_SESSION_ID;
2840  break;
2841  }
2842  else
2843  {
2844  ni_log(NI_LOG_DEBUG, "%s(): wait for close\n");
2845  ni_usleep(NI_SESSION_CLOSE_RETRY_INTERVAL_US);
2846  retval = NI_RETCODE_ERROR_NVME_CMD_FAILED;
2847  }
2848  */
2849  retry++;
2850  }
2851 
2852 END:
2853 
2854  ni_aligned_free(p_buffer);
2855  ni_aligned_free(p_ctx->p_all_zero_buf);
2856 
2857  //Sequence change related stuff cleanup here
2858  p_ctx->active_video_width = 0;
2859  p_ctx->active_video_height = 0;
2860  p_ctx->actual_video_width = 0;
2861  //End of sequence change related stuff cleanup
2862 
2863  if (p_ctx->pts_table)
2864  {
2865  ni_queue_free(&p_ctx->pts_table->list, p_ctx->buffer_pool);
2866  ni_aligned_free(p_ctx->pts_table);
2867  ni_log(NI_LOG_DEBUG, "ni_timestamp_done: success\n");
2868  }
2869 
2870  if (p_ctx->dts_queue)
2871  {
2872  ni_queue_free(&p_ctx->dts_queue->list, p_ctx->buffer_pool);
2873  ni_aligned_free(p_ctx->dts_queue);
2874  ni_log(NI_LOG_DEBUG, "ni_timestamp_done: success\n");
2875  }
2876 
2877  ni_buffer_pool_free(p_ctx->buffer_pool);
2878  p_ctx->buffer_pool = NULL;
2879 
2880  int i;
2881  for (i = 0; i < NI_FIFO_SZ; i++)
2882  {
2883  ni_aligned_free(p_ctx->pkt_custom_sei_set[i]);
2884  }
2885 
2886  ni_log(NI_LOG_DEBUG, "%s(): CTX[Card:%" PRIx64 " / HW:%d / INST:%d]\n",
2887  __func__, (int64_t)p_ctx->device_handle, p_ctx->hw_id,
2888  p_ctx->session_id);
2889  ni_log(NI_LOG_TRACE, "%s(): exit\n", __func__);
2890 
2891 #ifdef XCODER_DUMP_ENABLED
2892  if (p_ctx->p_dump[0])
2893  {
2894  fclose(p_ctx->p_dump[0]);
2895  p_ctx->p_dump[0] = NULL;
2896  }
2897  if (p_ctx->p_dump[1])
2898  {
2899  fclose(p_ctx->p_dump[1]);
2900  p_ctx->p_dump[1] = NULL;
2901  }
2902 #endif
2903 
2904  low_delay_signal(p_ctx);
2905  ni_pthread_mutex_unlock(&p_ctx->mutex);
2906 
2907  ni_log(NI_LOG_TRACE, "%s(): exit\n", __func__);
2908 
2909  return retval;
2910 }
2911 
2912 
2913 /*!******************************************************************************
2914  * \brief Send a YUV p_frame to encoder
2915  *
2916  * \param
2917  *
2918  * \return
2919  *******************************************************************************/
2920 int ni_encoder_session_write(ni_session_context_t* p_ctx, ni_frame_t* p_frame)
2921 {
2922  bool ishwframe = p_ctx->hw_action & NI_CODEC_HW_ENABLE;
2923  uint32_t size = 0;
2924  uint32_t metadata_size = NI_APP_ENC_FRAME_META_DATA_SIZE;
2925  uint32_t send_count = 0;
2926  uint32_t i = 0;
2927  uint32_t tx_size = 0, aligned_tx_size = 0;
2928  uint32_t sent_size = 0;
2929  uint32_t frame_size_bytes = 0;
2930  int retval = 0;
2931  ni_instance_buf_info_t buf_info = { 0 };
2932  ni_session_statistic_t sessionStatistic = {0};
2933 #ifdef MEASURE_LATENCY
2934  uint64_t abs_time_ns;
2935 #endif
2936 
2937  ni_log(NI_LOG_TRACE, "%s(): enter hw=%d\n", __func__, ishwframe);
2938  //niFrameSurface1_t* p_data3 = (niFrameSurface1_t*)((uint8_t*)p_frame->p_data[3]);
2940  //ni_log(NI_LOG_DEBUG, "%s:mar16 HW=%d ui16FrameIdx=%d i8InstID=%d device_handle=%d\n",
2941  // ishwframe, p_data3->ui16FrameIdx, p_data3->i8InstID, p_data3->device_handle);
2942  //ni_log(NI_LOG_DEBUG, "%s:Jun 29 device_handle=%d\n", p_ctx->device_handle);
2943 
2944  ni_pthread_mutex_lock(&p_ctx->mutex);
2945 
2946  if (!p_ctx || !p_frame)
2947  {
2948  ni_log(NI_LOG_ERROR, "ERROR: %s() passed parameters are null!, return\n",
2949  __func__);
2950  retval = NI_RETCODE_INVALID_PARAM;
2951  LRETURN;
2952  }
2953 
2954  uint8_t separate_metadata = p_frame->separate_metadata;
2955 
2956  if (NI_INVALID_SESSION_ID == p_ctx->session_id)
2957  {
2958  ni_log(NI_LOG_ERROR, "ERROR %s(): Invalid session ID, return.\n",
2959  __func__);
2960  retval = NI_RETCODE_ERROR_INVALID_SESSION;
2961  LRETURN;
2962  }
2963 
2964  low_delay_wait(p_ctx);
2965 
2966 #ifdef MEASURE_LATENCY
2967  if ((p_frame->dts != NI_NOPTS_VALUE) && (p_ctx->frame_time_q != NULL))
2968  {
2969  abs_time_ns = ni_gettime_ns();
2970  ni_lat_meas_q_add_entry((ni_lat_meas_q_t *)p_ctx->frame_time_q,
2971  abs_time_ns, p_frame->dts);
2972  }
2973 #endif
2974 
2975  /*!********************************************************************/
2976  /*!************ Sequence Change related stuff *************************/
2977  //First check squence changed related stuff.
2978  //We need to record the current hight/width params if we didn't do it before:
2979 
2980  if( p_frame->video_height)
2981  {
2982  p_ctx->active_video_width = p_frame->data_len[0] / p_frame->video_height;
2983  p_ctx->active_video_height = p_frame->video_height;
2984  }
2985  else if (p_frame->video_width)
2986  {
2987  ni_log(NI_LOG_DEBUG, "WARNING: passed video_height is not valid!, return\n");
2988  p_ctx->active_video_height = p_frame->data_len[0] / p_frame->video_width;
2989  p_ctx->active_video_width = p_frame->video_width;
2990  }
2991  else
2992  {
2993  ni_log(NI_LOG_ERROR, "ERROR: passed video_height and video_width are not valid!, return\n");
2994  retval = NI_RETCODE_PARAM_INVALID_VALUE;
2995  LRETURN;
2996  }
2997  // record actual width (in pixels / without padding) for sequnce change detection
2998  p_ctx->actual_video_width = p_frame->video_width;
2999 
3000  /*!************ Sequence Change related stuff end*************************/
3001  /*!********************************************************************/
3002 
3003  frame_size_bytes = p_frame->data_len[0] + p_frame->data_len[1] + p_frame->data_len[2] + p_frame->data_len[3] + p_frame->extra_data_len;
3004  ni_log(NI_LOG_DEBUG,
3005  "%s: data_len[0] %u data_len[1] %u "
3006  "data_len[2] %u extra_data_len %u frame_size_bytes %u\n",
3007  __func__, p_frame->data_len[0], p_frame->data_len[1],
3008  p_frame->data_len[2], p_frame->extra_data_len, frame_size_bytes);
3009 
3010  // skip query write buffer because we just send EOS
3011  if (!p_frame->end_of_stream)
3012  {
3013  for (;;)
3014  {
3015  query_sleep(p_ctx);
3016 
3017  if ( (((p_ctx->fw_rev[NI_XCODER_REVISION_API_MAJOR_VER_IDX] >
3018  (uint8_t)'6') ||
3019  (p_ctx->fw_rev[NI_XCODER_REVISION_API_MAJOR_VER_IDX] ==
3020  (uint8_t)'6' &&
3021  p_ctx->fw_rev[NI_XCODER_REVISION_API_MINOR_VER_IDX] >=
3022  (uint8_t)'5'))))
3023  {
3024  retval = ni_query_session_statistic_info(
3025  p_ctx, NI_DEVICE_TYPE_ENCODER, &sessionStatistic);
3026  CHECK_ERR_RC3(p_ctx, retval, sessionStatistic,
3027  nvme_admin_cmd_xcoder_query, p_ctx->device_type,
3028  p_ctx->hw_id, &(p_ctx->session_id));
3029  CHECK_VPU_RECOVERY(retval);
3030  buf_info.buf_avail_size = sessionStatistic.ui32WrBufAvailSize;
3031  } else
3032  {
3033  retval =
3034  ni_query_instance_buf_info(p_ctx, INST_BUF_INFO_RW_WRITE,
3035  NI_DEVICE_TYPE_ENCODER, &buf_info);
3036  CHECK_ERR_RC(p_ctx, retval, nvme_admin_cmd_xcoder_query,
3037  p_ctx->device_type, p_ctx->hw_id,
3038  &(p_ctx->session_id));
3039  CHECK_VPU_RECOVERY(retval);
3040  }
3041 
3042  if (NI_RETCODE_SUCCESS != retval ||
3043  buf_info.buf_avail_size < frame_size_bytes)
3044  {
3045  ni_log(NI_LOG_TRACE,
3046  "Enc write query retry %d. rc=%d. Available buf size %u < "
3047  "frame size %u\n", retval, send_count,
3048  buf_info.buf_avail_size, frame_size_bytes);
3049  // extend to 5000 retries for 8K encode on FPGA
3050  if (send_count >= NI_MAX_ENCODER_QUERY_RETRIES)
3051  {
3052  retval = ni_query_instance_buf_info(
3053  p_ctx, INST_BUF_INFO_RW_WRITE_BY_EP, NI_DEVICE_TYPE_ENCODER, &buf_info);
3054  if(NI_RETCODE_ERROR_UNSUPPORTED_FW_VERSION != retval)
3055  {
3056  CHECK_ERR_RC(p_ctx, retval, nvme_admin_cmd_xcoder_query,
3057  p_ctx->device_type, p_ctx->hw_id, &(p_ctx->session_id));
3058  CHECK_VPU_RECOVERY(retval);
3059  }
3060  else
3061  retval = NI_RETCODE_SUCCESS;
3062 
3063  ni_log(NI_LOG_ERROR,
3064  "ERROR enc query buf info exceeding max retries: "
3065  "%d, ",
3066  NI_MAX_ENCODER_QUERY_RETRIES);
3067  p_ctx->status = NI_RETCODE_NVME_SC_WRITE_BUFFER_FULL;
3068 
3069  LRETURN;
3070  }
3071  send_count++;
3072  ni_pthread_mutex_unlock(&p_ctx->mutex);
3073  ni_usleep(NI_RETRY_INTERVAL_100US);
3074  ni_pthread_mutex_lock(&p_ctx->mutex);
3075  } else
3076  {
3077  ni_log(NI_LOG_DEBUG,
3078  "Info enc write query success, available buf "
3079  "size %u >= frame size %u !\n",
3080  buf_info.buf_avail_size, frame_size_bytes);
3081  break;
3082  }
3083  }
3084  }
3085 
3086  // fill in metadata such as timestamp
3087  ni_metadata_enc_frame_t *p_meta;
3088  if (separate_metadata)
3089  {
3090  p_meta = (ni_metadata_enc_frame_t *)p_frame->p_metadata_buffer;
3091  } else
3092  {
3093  p_meta = (ni_metadata_enc_frame_t *)((uint8_t *)
3094  p_frame->p_data[2 + ishwframe] +
3095  p_frame->data_len[2 + ishwframe]);
3096  }
3097 
3098  if (p_meta) //When hwframe xcoding reaches eos, frame looks like swframe but no allocation for p_meta
3099  {
3100  p_meta->metadata_common.ui64_data.frame_tstamp = (uint64_t)p_frame->pts;
3101 
3102  p_meta->force_headers = 0; // p_frame->force_headers not implemented/used
3103  p_meta->use_cur_src_as_long_term_pic =
3104  p_frame->use_cur_src_as_long_term_pic;
3105  p_meta->use_long_term_ref = p_frame->use_long_term_ref;
3106 
3107  ni_log(NI_LOG_DEBUG,
3108  "%s: p_meta "
3109  "use_cur_src_as_long_term_pic %d use_long_term_ref %d\n",
3110  __func__, p_meta->use_cur_src_as_long_term_pic,
3111  p_meta->use_long_term_ref);
3112 
3113  p_meta->frame_force_type_enable = p_meta->frame_force_type = 0;
3114  // frame type to be forced to is supposed to be set correctly
3115  // in p_frame->ni_pict_type
3116  if (1 == p_ctx->force_frame_type || p_frame->force_key_frame)
3117  {
3118  if (p_frame->ni_pict_type)
3119  {
3120  p_meta->frame_force_type_enable = 1;
3121  p_meta->frame_force_type = p_frame->ni_pict_type;
3122  }
3123  ni_log(NI_LOG_DEBUG,
3124  "%s(): ctx->force_frame_type"
3125  " %d frame->force_key_frame %d force frame_num %" PRIu64 ""
3126  " type to %d\n",
3127  __func__, p_ctx->force_frame_type, p_frame->force_key_frame,
3128  p_ctx->frame_num, p_frame->ni_pict_type);
3129  }
3130 
3131  // force pic qp if specified
3132  p_meta->force_pic_qp_enable = p_meta->force_pic_qp_i =
3133  p_meta->force_pic_qp_p = p_meta->force_pic_qp_b = 0;
3134  if (p_frame->force_pic_qp)
3135  {
3136  p_meta->force_pic_qp_enable = 1;
3137  p_meta->force_pic_qp_i = p_meta->force_pic_qp_p =
3138  p_meta->force_pic_qp_b = p_frame->force_pic_qp;
3139  }
3140  p_meta->frame_sei_data_size = p_frame->sei_total_len;
3141  p_meta->frame_roi_map_size = p_frame->roi_len;
3142  p_meta->frame_roi_avg_qp = p_ctx->roi_avg_qp;
3143  p_meta->enc_reconfig_data_size = p_frame->reconf_len;
3144 
3145  ni_log(
3146  NI_LOG_DEBUG,
3147  "%s(): %d.%u p_ctx->frame_num=%" PRIu64 ", "
3148  "p_frame->start_of_stream=%u, p_frame->end_of_stream=%u, "
3149  "p_frame->video_width=%u, p_frame->video_height=%u, pts=0x%08x 0x%08x, "
3150  "dts=0x%08x 0x%08x, sei_len=%u, roi size=%u avg_qp=%u reconf_len=%u "
3151  "force_pic_qp=%u use_cur_src_as_long_term_pic %u use_long_term_ref "
3152  "%u\n",
3153  __func__, p_ctx->hw_id, p_ctx->session_id, p_ctx->frame_num,
3154  p_frame->start_of_stream, p_frame->end_of_stream, p_frame->video_width,
3155  p_frame->video_height, (uint32_t)((p_frame->pts >> 32) & 0xFFFFFFFF),
3156  (uint32_t)(p_frame->pts & 0xFFFFFFFF),
3157  (uint32_t)((p_frame->dts >> 32) & 0xFFFFFFFF),
3158  (uint32_t)(p_frame->dts & 0xFFFFFFFF), p_meta->frame_sei_data_size,
3159  p_meta->frame_roi_map_size, p_meta->frame_roi_avg_qp,
3160  p_meta->enc_reconfig_data_size, p_meta->force_pic_qp_i,
3161  p_meta->use_cur_src_as_long_term_pic, p_meta->use_long_term_ref);
3162  }
3163  if (p_frame->start_of_stream)
3164  {
3165  //Send Start of stream p_config command here
3166  retval = ni_config_instance_sos(p_ctx, NI_DEVICE_TYPE_ENCODER);
3167  CHECK_ERR_RC(p_ctx, retval, nvme_admin_cmd_xcoder_config,
3168  p_ctx->device_type, p_ctx->hw_id,
3169  &(p_ctx->session_id));
3170  CHECK_VPU_RECOVERY(retval);
3171  if (NI_RETCODE_SUCCESS != retval)
3172  {
3173  LRETURN;
3174  }
3175 
3176  p_frame->start_of_stream = 0;
3177  }
3178 
3179  // skip direct to send eos without sending the passed in p_frame as it's been sent already
3180  if (p_frame->end_of_stream)
3181  {
3182  retval = ni_config_instance_eos(p_ctx, NI_DEVICE_TYPE_ENCODER);
3183  CHECK_ERR_RC(p_ctx, retval, nvme_admin_cmd_xcoder_config,
3184  p_ctx->device_type, p_ctx->hw_id, &(p_ctx->session_id));
3185  CHECK_VPU_RECOVERY(retval);
3186  if (NI_RETCODE_SUCCESS != retval)
3187  {
3188  LRETURN;
3189  }
3190 
3191  p_frame->end_of_stream = 0;
3192  p_ctx->ready_to_close = 1;
3193  } else //handle regular frame sending
3194  {
3195  retval = ni_timestamp_register(p_ctx->buffer_pool, p_ctx->dts_queue,
3196  p_frame->dts, 0);
3197  if (NI_RETCODE_SUCCESS != retval)
3198  {
3199  ni_log(NI_LOG_ERROR,
3200  "ERROR %s(): "
3201  "ni_timestamp_register() for dts returned: %d\n",
3202  __func__, retval);
3203  }
3204 
3205  if (separate_metadata)
3206  {
3207  uint32_t ui32LBA_metadata =
3208  WRITE_METADATA_W(p_ctx->session_id, NI_DEVICE_TYPE_ENCODER);
3209  ni_log(NI_LOG_DEBUG,
3210  "%s: p_metadata_buffer = %p, metadata_buffer_size "
3211  "= %u, p_ctx->frame_num = %" PRIu64 ", LBA = 0x%x\n",
3212  __func__, p_frame->p_metadata_buffer,
3213  p_frame->metadata_buffer_size, p_ctx->frame_num,
3214  ui32LBA_metadata);
3215  retval = ni_nvme_send_write_cmd(
3216  p_ctx->blk_io_handle, p_ctx->event_handle,
3217  p_frame->p_metadata_buffer, p_frame->metadata_buffer_size,
3218  ui32LBA_metadata);
3219  CHECK_ERR_RC(p_ctx, retval, nvme_cmd_xcoder_write, p_ctx->device_type,
3220  p_ctx->hw_id, &(p_ctx->session_id));
3221  CHECK_VPU_RECOVERY(retval);
3222  if (retval < 0)
3223  {
3224  ni_log(NI_LOG_ERROR, "ERROR %s(): nvme command failed\n",
3225  __func__);
3226  retval = NI_RETCODE_ERROR_NVME_CMD_FAILED;
3227  LRETURN;
3228  }
3229  }
3230 
3231  uint32_t ui32LBA =
3232  WRITE_INSTANCE_W(p_ctx->session_id, NI_DEVICE_TYPE_ENCODER);
3233  ni_log(NI_LOG_DEBUG,
3234  "%s: p_data = %p, p_frame->buffer_size "
3235  "= %u, p_ctx->frame_num = %" PRIu64 ", LBA = 0x%x\n",
3236  __func__, p_frame->p_data, p_frame->buffer_size, p_ctx->frame_num,
3237  ui32LBA);
3238  sent_size = separate_metadata ?
3239  frame_size_bytes - p_frame->extra_data_len :
3240  frame_size_bytes;
3241  if (sent_size % NI_MEM_PAGE_ALIGNMENT)
3242  {
3243  sent_size =
3244  ((sent_size / NI_MEM_PAGE_ALIGNMENT) * NI_MEM_PAGE_ALIGNMENT) +
3245  NI_MEM_PAGE_ALIGNMENT;
3246  }
3247 
3248  retval = ni_nvme_send_write_cmd(p_ctx->blk_io_handle, p_ctx->event_handle,
3249  p_frame->p_buffer, sent_size, ui32LBA);
3250  CHECK_ERR_RC(p_ctx, retval, nvme_cmd_xcoder_write, p_ctx->device_type,
3251  p_ctx->hw_id, &(p_ctx->session_id));
3252  CHECK_VPU_RECOVERY(retval);
3253  if (retval < 0)
3254  {
3255  ni_log(NI_LOG_ERROR, "ERROR %s(): nvme command failed\n", __func__);
3256  retval = NI_RETCODE_ERROR_NVME_CMD_FAILED;
3257  LRETURN;
3258  }
3259 
3260  p_ctx->status = 0;
3261  p_ctx->frame_num++;
3262  size = frame_size_bytes;
3263  p_ctx->low_delay_sync_flag = 1;
3264 
3265 #ifdef XCODER_DUMP_DATA
3266  char dump_file[256];
3267  snprintf(dump_file, sizeof(dump_file), "%ld-%u-enc-fme/fme-%04ld.yuv",
3268  (long)getpid(), p_ctx->session_id, (long)p_ctx->frame_num);
3269 
3270  FILE *f = fopen(dump_file, "wb");
3271  fwrite(p_frame->p_buffer,
3272  p_frame->data_len[0] + p_frame->data_len[1] + p_frame->data_len[2],
3273  1, f);
3274  fflush(f);
3275  fclose(f);
3276 #endif
3277  }
3278 
3279  retval = size;
3280 
3281 END:
3282 
3283  ni_pthread_mutex_unlock(&p_ctx->mutex);
3284 
3285  ni_log(NI_LOG_TRACE, "%s(): exit\n", __func__);
3286  return retval;
3287 }
3288 
3289 
3290 int ni_encoder_session_read(ni_session_context_t* p_ctx, ni_packet_t* p_packet)
3291 {
3292  ni_instance_mgr_stream_info_t data = { 0 };
3293  uint32_t actual_read_size = 0;
3294  uint32_t to_read_size = 0;
3295  int size = 0;
3296  uint32_t query_return_size = 0;
3297  uint32_t partial_data = 0;
3298  uint8_t* p_data = NULL;
3299  static long long encq_count = 0LL;
3300  int retval = NI_RETCODE_SUCCESS;
3301  int query_retry = 0;
3302  int query_type = INST_BUF_INFO_RW_READ;
3303  uint32_t ui32LBA = 0;
3304  ni_metadata_enc_bstream_t *p_meta = NULL;
3305  ni_metadata_enc_bstream_rev61_t *p_meta_rev61 = NULL;
3306  ni_instance_buf_info_t buf_info = { 0 };
3307  ni_session_statistic_t sessionStatistic = {0};
3308  int low_delay_notify = 0;
3309 #ifdef MEASURE_LATENCY
3310  uint64_t abs_time_ns;
3311 #endif
3312 
3313  ni_log(NI_LOG_TRACE, "%s(): enter\n", __func__);
3314 
3315  ni_pthread_mutex_lock(&p_ctx->mutex);
3316 
3317  if (!p_ctx || !p_packet || !p_packet->p_data)
3318  {
3319  ni_log(NI_LOG_ERROR, "ERROR: %s() passed parameters are null!, return\n",
3320  __func__);
3321  retval = NI_RETCODE_INVALID_PARAM;
3322  LRETURN;
3323  }
3324 
3325  if (NI_INVALID_SESSION_ID == p_ctx->session_id)
3326  {
3327  ni_log(NI_LOG_ERROR, "ERROR %s(): Invalid session ID, return.\n",
3328  __func__);
3329  retval = NI_RETCODE_ERROR_INVALID_SESSION;
3330  LRETURN;
3331  }
3332 
3333  ni_log(NI_LOG_DEBUG, "frame_num=%" PRIu64 ", pkt_num=%" PRIu64 "\n",
3334  p_ctx->frame_num, p_ctx->pkt_num);
3335  if (((ni_xcoder_params_t *)p_ctx->p_session_config)->low_delay_mode)
3336  {
3337  query_type = INST_BUF_INFO_RW_READ_BUSY;
3338  if (!p_packet->end_of_stream && p_ctx->frame_num < p_ctx->pkt_num)
3339  {
3340  if (p_ctx->ready_to_close)
3341  {
3342  query_type = INST_BUF_INFO_RW_READ;
3343  } else
3344  { //nothing to query, leave
3345  retval = NI_RETCODE_SUCCESS;
3346  LRETURN;
3347  }
3348  }
3349  }
3350  for (;;)
3351  {
3352  query_sleep(p_ctx);
3353 
3354  query_retry++;
3355 
3356  if ( (((p_ctx->fw_rev[NI_XCODER_REVISION_API_MAJOR_VER_IDX] >
3357  (uint8_t)'6') ||
3358  (p_ctx->fw_rev[NI_XCODER_REVISION_API_MAJOR_VER_IDX] ==
3359  (uint8_t)'6' &&
3360  p_ctx->fw_rev[NI_XCODER_REVISION_API_MINOR_VER_IDX] >= (uint8_t)'5'))))
3361  {
3362  retval = ni_query_session_statistic_info(
3363  p_ctx, NI_DEVICE_TYPE_ENCODER, &sessionStatistic);
3364  CHECK_ERR_RC3(p_ctx, retval, sessionStatistic,
3365  nvme_admin_cmd_xcoder_query, p_ctx->device_type,
3366  p_ctx->hw_id, &(p_ctx->session_id));
3367  CHECK_VPU_RECOVERY(retval);
3368 
3369  buf_info.buf_avail_size = sessionStatistic.ui32RdBufAvailSize;
3370  } else
3371  {
3372  retval = ni_query_instance_buf_info(
3373  p_ctx, query_type, NI_DEVICE_TYPE_ENCODER, &buf_info);
3374  CHECK_ERR_RC(p_ctx, retval, nvme_admin_cmd_xcoder_query,
3375  p_ctx->device_type, p_ctx->hw_id, &(p_ctx->session_id));
3376  CHECK_VPU_RECOVERY(retval);
3377  }
3378 
3379  ni_log(NI_LOG_DEBUG, "Info enc read query rc %d, available buf size %u, "
3380  "frame_num=%" PRIu64 ", pkt_num=%" PRIu64 "\n",
3381  retval, buf_info.buf_avail_size, p_ctx->frame_num,
3382  p_ctx->pkt_num);
3383 
3384  if (NI_RETCODE_SUCCESS != retval)
3385  {
3386  ni_log(NI_LOG_ERROR, "Buffer info query failed in encoder read!!!!\n");
3387  LRETURN;
3388  } else if (0 == buf_info.buf_avail_size)
3389  {
3390  // query to see if it is eos now, if we have sent it
3391  if (p_ctx->ready_to_close)
3392  {
3393  retval = ni_query_stream_info(p_ctx, NI_DEVICE_TYPE_ENCODER, &data);
3394  CHECK_ERR_RC(p_ctx, retval, nvme_admin_cmd_xcoder_query,
3395  p_ctx->device_type, p_ctx->hw_id,
3396  &(p_ctx->session_id));
3397  CHECK_VPU_RECOVERY(retval);
3398 
3399  if (NI_RETCODE_SUCCESS != retval)
3400  {
3401  ni_log(NI_LOG_ERROR, "Stream info query failed in encoder read!!!!\n");
3402  LRETURN;
3403  }
3404 
3405  if (data.is_flushed)
3406  {
3407  p_packet->end_of_stream = 1;
3408  }
3409  }
3410  ni_log(NI_LOG_DEBUG, "Info enc read available buf size %u, eos %u !\n",
3411  buf_info.buf_avail_size, p_packet->end_of_stream);
3412 
3413  if ((((ni_xcoder_params_t *)p_ctx->p_session_config)->low_delay_mode ||
3414  (NI_RETCODE_NVME_SC_WRITE_BUFFER_FULL == p_ctx->status)) &&
3415  !p_packet->end_of_stream && p_ctx->frame_num >= p_ctx->pkt_num)
3416  {
3417  ni_log(NI_LOG_DEBUG, "Encoder low latency mode, eos not sent, frame_num "
3418  "%" PRIu64 " >= %" PRIu64 " pkt_num, keep querying p_ctx->status %d\n",
3419  p_ctx->frame_num, p_ctx->pkt_num, p_ctx->status);
3420  ni_pthread_mutex_unlock(&p_ctx->mutex);
3421  ni_usleep(NI_RETRY_INTERVAL_200US);
3422  ni_pthread_mutex_lock(&p_ctx->mutex);
3423  if (query_retry >= NI_MAX_ENCODER_QUERY_RETRIES &&
3424  NI_RETCODE_NVME_SC_WRITE_BUFFER_FULL == p_ctx->status)
3425  {
3426  low_delay_notify = 1;
3427  retval = NI_RETCODE_ERROR_RESOURCE_UNAVAILABLE;
3428  LRETURN;
3429  }
3430  else
3431  {
3432  continue;
3433  }
3434  }
3435  retval = NI_RETCODE_SUCCESS;
3436  LRETURN;
3437  } else
3438  {
3439  break;
3440  }
3441  }
3442  ni_log(NI_LOG_DEBUG, "Encoder read buf_avail_size %u\n", buf_info.buf_avail_size);
3443 
3444  to_read_size = buf_info.buf_avail_size;
3445 
3446  p_packet->data_len = 0;
3447  p_packet->pts = NI_NOPTS_VALUE;
3448  p_packet->dts = 0;
3449 
3450  ui32LBA = READ_INSTANCE_R(p_ctx->session_id, NI_DEVICE_TYPE_ENCODER);
3451  actual_read_size = to_read_size;
3452  if (actual_read_size % NI_MEM_PAGE_ALIGNMENT)
3453  {
3454  actual_read_size =
3455  ((actual_read_size / NI_MEM_PAGE_ALIGNMENT) * NI_MEM_PAGE_ALIGNMENT) +
3456  NI_MEM_PAGE_ALIGNMENT;
3457  }
3458 
3459  if (p_packet->buffer_size < actual_read_size)
3460  {
3461  if (ni_packet_buffer_alloc(p_packet, actual_read_size))
3462  {
3463  ni_log(NI_LOG_ERROR,
3464  "ERROR %s(): packet buffer size %u allocation "
3465  "failed\n",
3466  __func__, actual_read_size);
3467  retval = NI_RETCODE_ERROR_MEM_ALOC;
3468  LRETURN;
3469  }
3470  }
3471 
3472  retval = ni_nvme_send_read_cmd(p_ctx->blk_io_handle, p_ctx->event_handle,
3473  p_packet->p_data, actual_read_size, ui32LBA);
3474  CHECK_ERR_RC(p_ctx, retval, nvme_cmd_xcoder_read, p_ctx->device_type,
3475  p_ctx->hw_id, &(p_ctx->session_id));
3476  CHECK_VPU_RECOVERY(retval);
3477  if (retval < 0)
3478  {
3479  ni_log(NI_LOG_ERROR, "ERROR %s(): nvme command failed\n", __func__);
3480  retval = NI_RETCODE_ERROR_NVME_CMD_FAILED;
3481  LRETURN;
3482  }
3483 
3484  // SSIM is supported if fw_rev is higher than major 6 minor 1.
3485  if (is_fw_rev_higher(p_ctx, (uint8_t)'6', (uint8_t)'1'))
3486  {
3487  p_meta = (ni_metadata_enc_bstream_t *)p_packet->p_data;
3488  p_packet->pts = (int64_t)(p_meta->frame_tstamp);
3489  p_packet->frame_type = p_meta->frame_type;
3490  p_packet->avg_frame_qp = p_meta->avg_frame_qp;
3491  p_packet->recycle_index = p_meta->recycle_index;
3492  p_packet->av1_show_frame = p_meta->av1_show_frame;
3493  ni_log(NI_LOG_DEBUG, "%s RECYCLE INDEX = %u!!!\n", __FUNCTION__, p_meta->recycle_index);
3494 
3495  p_ctx->meta_size = p_meta->metadata_size;
3496 
3497  if (p_meta->ssimY != 0)
3498  {
3499  // The SSIM Y, U, V values returned by FW are 4 decimal places multiplied by 10000.
3500  //Divide by 10000 to get the original value.
3501  ni_log(NI_LOG_DEBUG, "%s: ssim Y %.4f U %.4f V %.4f\n", __FUNCTION__,
3502  (float)p_meta->ssimY/10000, (float)p_meta->ssimU/10000, (float)p_meta->ssimV/10000);
3503  }
3504  }
3505  else
3506  {
3507  // Up to fw_rev major 6 and minor 1, use the old meta data structure
3508  p_meta_rev61 = (ni_metadata_enc_bstream_rev61_t *)p_packet->p_data;
3509  p_packet->pts = (int64_t)(p_meta_rev61->frame_tstamp);
3510  p_packet->frame_type = p_meta_rev61->frame_type;
3511  p_packet->avg_frame_qp = p_meta_rev61->avg_frame_qp;
3512  p_packet->recycle_index = p_meta_rev61->recycle_index;
3513  p_packet->av1_show_frame = p_meta_rev61->av1_show_frame;
3514  ni_log(NI_LOG_DEBUG, "%s RECYCLE INDEX = %u!!!\n", __FUNCTION__, p_meta_rev61->recycle_index);
3515 
3516  }
3517 
3518  p_packet->data_len = to_read_size;
3519 
3520  size = p_packet->data_len;
3521 
3522  if (size > 0)
3523  {
3524  if (p_ctx->pkt_num >= 1)
3525  {
3526  if (ni_timestamp_get_with_threshold(p_ctx->dts_queue, 0, (int64_t*)& p_packet->dts, 0, encq_count % 500 == 0, p_ctx->buffer_pool) != NI_RETCODE_SUCCESS)
3527  {
3528  p_packet->dts = NI_NOPTS_VALUE;
3529  }
3530  p_ctx->pkt_num++;
3531  low_delay_notify = 1;
3532  }
3533 
3534  encq_count++;
3535 
3536 #ifdef XCODER_DUMP_DATA
3537  char dump_file[256];
3538  snprintf(dump_file, sizeof(dump_file), "%ld-%u-enc-pkt/pkt-%04ld.bin",
3539  (long)getpid(), p_ctx->session_id, (long)p_ctx->pkt_num);
3540 
3541  FILE *f = fopen(dump_file, "wb");
3542  fwrite((uint8_t *)p_packet->p_data + sizeof(ni_metadata_enc_bstream_t),
3543  p_packet->data_len - sizeof(ni_metadata_enc_bstream_t), 1, f);
3544  fflush(f);
3545  fclose(f);
3546 #endif
3547  }
3548 
3549  ni_log(
3550  NI_LOG_DEBUG,
3551  "%s(): %d.%u p_packet->start_of_stream=%u, "
3552  "p_packet->end_of_stream=%u, p_packet->video_width=%u, "
3553  "p_packet->video_height=%u, p_packet->dts=0x%08x 0x%08x, "
3554  "p_packet->pts=0x%08x 0x%08x, type=%u, avg_frame_qp=%u, show_frame=%d\n",
3555  __func__, p_ctx->hw_id, p_ctx->session_id, p_packet->start_of_stream,
3556  p_packet->end_of_stream, p_packet->video_width, p_packet->video_height,
3557  (uint32_t)((p_packet->dts >> 32) & 0xFFFFFFFF),
3558  (uint32_t)(p_packet->dts & 0xFFFFFFFF),
3559  (uint32_t)((p_packet->pts >> 32) & 0xFFFFFFFF),
3560  (uint32_t)(p_packet->pts & 0xFFFFFFFF), p_packet->frame_type,
3561  p_packet->avg_frame_qp, p_packet->av1_show_frame);
3562 
3563  ni_log(NI_LOG_DEBUG, "%s(): p_packet->data_len=%u, size=%d\n", __func__,
3564  p_packet->data_len, size);
3565 
3566  if (encq_count % 500 == 0)
3567  {
3568  ni_log(NI_LOG_DEBUG,
3569  "Encoder pts queue size = %u dts queue size = %u\n\n",
3570  p_ctx->pts_table->list.count, p_ctx->dts_queue->list.count);
3571  }
3572 
3573  retval = size;
3574 
3575 #ifdef MEASURE_LATENCY
3576  if ((p_packet->dts != NI_NOPTS_VALUE) && (p_ctx->frame_time_q != NULL))
3577  {
3578  abs_time_ns = ni_gettime_ns();
3579  ni_log(NI_LOG_INFO, "DTS:%lld,DELTA:%lu,eLAT:%lu;\n", p_packet->dts,
3580  abs_time_ns - p_ctx->prev_read_frame_time,
3581  ni_lat_meas_q_check_latency((ni_lat_meas_q_t *)p_ctx->frame_time_q,
3582  abs_time_ns, p_packet->dts));
3583  p_ctx->prev_read_frame_time = abs_time_ns;
3584  }
3585 #endif
3586 
3587 END:
3588 
3589  ni_pthread_mutex_unlock(&p_ctx->mutex);
3590 
3591  if (low_delay_notify)
3592  {
3593  low_delay_signal(p_ctx);
3594  }
3595 
3596  ni_log(NI_LOG_TRACE, "%s(): exit\n", __func__);
3597 
3598  return retval;
3599 }
3600 
3601 /*!******************************************************************************
3602  * \brief Send sequnce change to a xcoder encoder instance
3603  *
3604  * \param
3605  *
3606  * \return
3607  *******************************************************************************/
3608 ni_retcode_t ni_encoder_session_sequence_change(ni_session_context_t* p_ctx, ni_resolution_t *p_resolution)
3609 {
3610  ni_retcode_t retval = NI_RETCODE_SUCCESS;
3611 
3612  ni_log(NI_LOG_TRACE, "%s(): enter\n", __func__);
3613 
3614  //Configure encoder sequence change
3615  retval = ni_config_instance_set_sequence_change(p_ctx, NI_DEVICE_TYPE_ENCODER,
3616  p_resolution);
3617  CHECK_ERR_RC(p_ctx, retval, nvme_config_xcoder_config_set_sequence_change,
3618  p_ctx->device_type, p_ctx->hw_id,
3619  &(p_ctx->session_id));
3620  CHECK_VPU_RECOVERY(retval);
3621  if (retval < 0)
3622  {
3623  ni_log(NI_LOG_ERROR, "ERROR %s(): config encoder sequence change command failed\n",
3624  __func__);
3625  retval = NI_RETCODE_ERROR_NVME_CMD_FAILED;
3626  }
3627 
3628 END:
3629 
3630  ni_log(NI_LOG_TRACE, "%s(): exit\n", __func__);
3631 
3632  return retval;
3633 }
3634 
3635 /*!******************************************************************************
3636  * \brief Open a xcoder scaler instance
3637  *
3638  * \param[in] p_ctx pointer to session context
3639  *
3640  * \return NI_RETCODE_INVALID_PARAM
3641  * NI_RETCODE_ERROR_NVME_CMD_FAILED
3642  * NI_RETCODE_ERROR_INVALID_SESSION
3643  * NI_RETCODE_ERROR_MEM_ALOC
3644  *******************************************************************************/
3645 int ni_scaler_session_open(ni_session_context_t* p_ctx)
3646 {
3647  ni_retcode_t retval = NI_RETCODE_SUCCESS;
3648  void* p_buffer = NULL;
3649  uint32_t ui32LBA = 0;
3650 
3651  ni_log(NI_LOG_TRACE, "%s(): enter\n", __func__);
3652 
3653  if (!p_ctx)
3654  {
3655  retval = NI_RETCODE_INVALID_PARAM;
3656  LRETURN;
3657  }
3658 
3659  if (p_ctx->scaler_operation == NI_SCALER_OPCODE_STACK)
3660  {
3661  if ((p_ctx->fw_rev[NI_XCODER_REVISION_API_MAJOR_VER_IDX] < '6') ||
3662  ((p_ctx->fw_rev[NI_XCODER_REVISION_API_MAJOR_VER_IDX] == '6') &&
3663  (p_ctx->fw_rev[NI_XCODER_REVISION_API_MINOR_VER_IDX] < '4')))
3664  {
3665  ni_log(NI_LOG_ERROR, "ERROR: "
3666  "FW revision %c%c is less then the minimum required 64\n",
3667  p_ctx->fw_rev[NI_XCODER_REVISION_API_MAJOR_VER_IDX],
3668  p_ctx->fw_rev[NI_XCODER_REVISION_API_MINOR_VER_IDX]
3669  );
3670  return NI_RETCODE_ERROR_UNSUPPORTED_FW_VERSION;
3671  }
3672  }
3673 
3674  if (p_ctx->scaler_operation == NI_SCALER_OPCODE_ROTATE)
3675  {
3676  if ((p_ctx->fw_rev[NI_XCODER_REVISION_API_MAJOR_VER_IDX] < '6') ||
3677  ((p_ctx->fw_rev[NI_XCODER_REVISION_API_MAJOR_VER_IDX] == '6') &&
3678  (p_ctx->fw_rev[NI_XCODER_REVISION_API_MINOR_VER_IDX] < '7')))
3679  {
3680  ni_log(NI_LOG_ERROR, "ERROR: "
3681  "FW revision %c%c is less then the minimum required 67\n",
3682  p_ctx->fw_rev[NI_XCODER_REVISION_API_MAJOR_VER_IDX],
3683  p_ctx->fw_rev[NI_XCODER_REVISION_API_MINOR_VER_IDX]
3684  );
3685  return NI_RETCODE_ERROR_UNSUPPORTED_FW_VERSION;
3686  }
3687  }
3688 
3689  if (p_ctx->session_id == NI_INVALID_SESSION_ID)
3690  {
3691  p_ctx->device_type = NI_DEVICE_TYPE_SCALER;
3692  p_ctx->pts_table = NULL;
3693  p_ctx->dts_queue = NULL;
3694  p_ctx->p_leftover = NULL;
3695  p_ctx->buffer_pool = NULL;
3696  p_ctx->dec_fme_buf_pool = NULL;
3697  p_ctx->prev_size = 0;
3698  p_ctx->sent_size = 0;
3699  p_ctx->status = 0;
3700  p_ctx->key_frame_type = 0;
3701  p_ctx->ready_to_close = 0;
3702  p_ctx->rc_error_count = 0;
3703  p_ctx->frame_num = 0;
3704  p_ctx->pkt_num = 0;
3705  p_ctx->pkt_index = 0;
3706 
3707  //malloc zero data buffer
3708  if (ni_posix_memalign(&p_ctx->p_all_zero_buf, sysconf(_SC_PAGESIZE),
3709  NI_DATA_BUFFER_LEN))
3710  {
3711  ni_log(NI_LOG_ERROR, "ERROR %d: %s() alloc all zero buffer failed\n",
3712  NI_ERRNO, __func__);
3713  retval = NI_RETCODE_ERROR_MEM_ALOC;
3714  LRETURN;
3715  }
3716  memset(p_ctx->p_all_zero_buf, 0, NI_DATA_BUFFER_LEN);
3717 
3718  //malloc data buffer
3719  if (ni_posix_memalign(&p_buffer, sysconf(_SC_PAGESIZE), NI_DATA_BUFFER_LEN))
3720  {
3721  ni_log(NI_LOG_ERROR, "ERROR %d: %s() alloc data buffer failed\n",
3722  NI_ERRNO, __func__);
3723  retval = NI_RETCODE_ERROR_MEM_ALOC;
3724  LRETURN;
3725  }
3726  memset(p_buffer, 0, NI_DATA_BUFFER_LEN);
3727 
3728  //Set session ID to be invalid. In case we cannot open session, the session id wold remain invalid.
3729  //In case we can open sesison, the session id would become valid.
3730  ((ni_session_stats_t *)p_buffer)->ui16SessionId =
3731  (uint16_t)NI_INVALID_SESSION_ID;
3732 
3733  // First uint32_t is either an invaild session ID or a valid session ID, depending on if session could be opened
3734  ui32LBA = OPEN_SESSION_CODEC(NI_DEVICE_TYPE_SCALER, ni_htonl(p_ctx->scaler_operation), 0);
3735  retval = ni_nvme_send_read_cmd(p_ctx->blk_io_handle, p_ctx->event_handle,
3736  p_buffer, NI_DATA_BUFFER_LEN, ui32LBA);
3737  if (retval != NI_RETCODE_SUCCESS)
3738  {
3739  ni_log(NI_LOG_ERROR, "ERROR ni_nvme_send_read_cmd\n");
3740  LRETURN;
3741  }
3742  //Open will return a session status structure with a valid session id if it worked.
3743  //Otherwise the invalid session id set before the open command will stay
3744  p_ctx->session_id = ni_ntohs(((ni_session_stats_t *)p_buffer)->ui16SessionId);
3745  p_ctx->session_timestamp =
3746  ni_htonll(((ni_session_stats_t *)p_buffer)->ui64Session_timestamp);
3747  if (NI_INVALID_SESSION_ID == p_ctx->session_id)
3748  {
3749  ni_log(NI_LOG_ERROR,
3750  "ERROR %s(): p_ctx->device_handle=%" PRIx64
3751  ", p_ctx->hw_id=%d, p_ctx->session_id=%d\n",
3752  __func__, (int64_t)p_ctx->device_handle, p_ctx->hw_id,
3753  p_ctx->session_id);
3754  retval = NI_RETCODE_ERROR_INVALID_SESSION;
3755  LRETURN;
3756  }
3757  ni_log(NI_LOG_DEBUG, "Scaler open session ID:0x%x\n",p_ctx->session_id);
3758  ni_log(NI_LOG_DEBUG,
3759  "%s(): p_ctx->device_handle=%" PRIx64
3760  ", p_ctx->hw_id=%d, p_ctx->session_id=%d\n",
3761  __func__, (int64_t)p_ctx->device_handle, p_ctx->hw_id,
3762  p_ctx->session_id);
3763 
3764  //Send keep alive timeout Info
3765  uint64_t keep_alive_timeout =
3766  p_ctx->keep_alive_timeout * 1000000; //send us to FW
3767  memset(p_buffer, 0, NI_DATA_BUFFER_LEN);
3768  memcpy(p_buffer, &keep_alive_timeout, sizeof(keep_alive_timeout));
3769  ni_log(NI_LOG_DEBUG, "%s keep_alive_timeout %" PRIx64 "\n", __func__,
3770  keep_alive_timeout);
3771  ui32LBA = CONFIG_SESSION_KeepAliveTimeout_W(p_ctx->session_id);
3772  retval = ni_nvme_send_write_cmd(p_ctx->blk_io_handle, p_ctx->event_handle,
3773  p_buffer, NI_DATA_BUFFER_LEN, ui32LBA);
3774  CHECK_ERR_RC(p_ctx, retval, nvme_admin_cmd_xcoder_config, p_ctx->device_type,
3775  p_ctx->hw_id, &(p_ctx->session_id));
3776  CHECK_VPU_RECOVERY(retval);
3777 
3778  if (NI_RETCODE_SUCCESS != retval)
3779  {
3780  ni_log(NI_LOG_ERROR,
3781  "ERROR %s(): nvme write keep_alive_timeout command "
3782  "failed, blk_io_handle: %" PRIx64 ", hw_id, %d\n",
3783  __func__, (int64_t)p_ctx->blk_io_handle, p_ctx->hw_id);
3784  retval = NI_RETCODE_ERROR_NVME_CMD_FAILED;
3785  LRETURN;
3786  }
3787 
3788  // Send SW version to FW if FW version is higher than major 6 minor 1
3789  if (is_fw_rev_higher(p_ctx, (uint8_t)'6', (uint8_t)'1'))
3790  {
3791  // Send SW version to session manager
3792  memset(p_buffer, 0, NI_DATA_BUFFER_LEN);
3793  memcpy(p_buffer, NI_XCODER_REVISION, sizeof(uint64_t));
3794  ni_log(NI_LOG_DEBUG, "%s sw_version major %c minor %c fw_rev major %c minor %c\n", __func__,
3795  NI_XCODER_REVISION[NI_XCODER_REVISION_API_MAJOR_VER_IDX],
3796  NI_XCODER_REVISION[NI_XCODER_REVISION_API_MINOR_VER_IDX],
3797  p_ctx->fw_rev[NI_XCODER_REVISION_API_MAJOR_VER_IDX],
3798  p_ctx->fw_rev[NI_XCODER_REVISION_API_MINOR_VER_IDX]);
3799  ui32LBA = CONFIG_SESSION_SWVersion_W(p_ctx->session_id);
3800  retval = ni_nvme_send_write_cmd(p_ctx->blk_io_handle, p_ctx->event_handle,
3801  p_buffer, NI_DATA_BUFFER_LEN, ui32LBA);
3802  CHECK_ERR_RC(p_ctx, retval, nvme_admin_cmd_xcoder_config, p_ctx->device_type,
3803  p_ctx->hw_id, &(p_ctx->session_id));
3804  CHECK_VPU_RECOVERY(retval);
3805 
3806  if (NI_RETCODE_SUCCESS != retval)
3807  {
3808  ni_log(NI_LOG_ERROR,
3809  "ERROR %s(): nvme write sw_version command "
3810  "failed, blk_io_handle: %" PRIx64 ", hw_id, %d\n",
3811  __func__, (int64_t)p_ctx->blk_io_handle, p_ctx->hw_id);
3812  retval = NI_RETCODE_ERROR_NVME_CMD_FAILED;
3813  LRETURN;
3814  }
3815  }
3816  }
3817 
3818  // init for frame pts calculation
3819  p_ctx->is_first_frame = 1;
3820  p_ctx->last_pts = 0;
3821  p_ctx->last_dts = 0;
3822  p_ctx->active_video_width = 0;
3823  p_ctx->active_video_height = 0;
3824  p_ctx->actual_video_width = 0;
3825 
3826 #ifndef _WIN32
3827  if (p_ctx->isP2P)
3828  {
3829  int ret;
3830  char line[256];
3831  char syspath[256];
3832  struct stat bstat;
3833  char *block_dev;
3834  char *dom, *bus, *dev, *fnc;
3835  FILE *fp;
3836 
3837  p_ctx->netint_fd = open("/dev/netint", O_RDWR);
3838  if (p_ctx->netint_fd < 0)
3839  {
3840  ni_log(NI_LOG_ERROR, "ERROR: Can't open device /dev/netint\n");
3841  return NI_RETCODE_FAILURE;
3842  }
3843 
3844  block_dev = &p_ctx->blk_xcoder_name[0];
3845  if (stat(block_dev, &bstat) < 0)
3846  {
3847  ni_log(NI_LOG_ERROR, "failed to get stat of file %s\n", block_dev);
3848  return NI_RETCODE_FAILURE;
3849  }
3850 
3851  if ((bstat.st_mode & S_IFMT) != S_IFBLK)
3852  {
3853  ni_log(NI_LOG_ERROR, "%s is not a block device\n", block_dev);
3854  return NI_RETCODE_FAILURE;
3855  }
3856 
3857  ret = snprintf(syspath, sizeof(syspath) - 1,
3858  "udevadm info -q path -n %s | perl -nle'print $& "
3859  "while m{(?<=/)[0-9a-f]{4}:[0-9a-f]{2}:[0-9a-f]{2}\\.[0-9a-f]}g' | tail -n 1", block_dev + 5);
3860  syspath[ret] = '\0';
3861 
3862  fp = popen(syspath, "r");
3863 
3864  if (fp == NULL)
3865  {
3866  ni_log(NI_LOG_ERROR, "Failed to read address\n");
3867  return NI_RETCODE_FAILURE;
3868  }
3869 
3870  if (fgets(line, 256, fp) == NULL)
3871  {
3872  ni_log(NI_LOG_ERROR, "Failed to read line from address\n");
3873  pclose(fp);
3874  return NI_RETCODE_FAILURE;
3875  }
3876 
3877  pclose(fp);
3878 
3879  errno = 0;
3880  p_ctx->domain = strtoul(line, &dom, 16);
3881  if (errno < 0)
3882  {
3883  ni_log(NI_LOG_ERROR, "Failed to read PCI domain\n");
3884  return NI_RETCODE_FAILURE;
3885  }
3886 
3887  errno = 0;
3888  p_ctx->bus = strtoul(dom + 1, &bus, 16);
3889  if (errno < 0)
3890  {
3891  ni_log(NI_LOG_ERROR, "Failed to read PCI bus\n");
3892  return NI_RETCODE_FAILURE;
3893  }
3894 
3895  errno = 0;
3896  p_ctx->dev = strtoul(bus + 1, &dev, 16);
3897 
3898  if (errno < 0)
3899  {
3900  ni_log(NI_LOG_ERROR, "Failed to read PCI device\n");
3901  return NI_RETCODE_FAILURE;
3902  }
3903 
3904  errno = 0;
3905  p_ctx->fn = strtoul(dev + 1, &fnc, 16);
3906 
3907  if (errno < 0)
3908  {
3909  ni_log(NI_LOG_ERROR, "Falied to read PCI function\n");
3910  return NI_RETCODE_FAILURE;
3911  }
3912 
3913  ni_log(NI_LOG_DEBUG, "PCI slot = %d:%d:%d:%d\n", p_ctx->domain,
3914  p_ctx->bus, p_ctx->dev, p_ctx->fn);
3915  }
3916 #endif
3917 
3918 END:
3919 
3920  ni_aligned_free(p_buffer);
3921  return retval;
3922 }
3923 
3924 /*!******************************************************************************
3925  * \brief close a scaler session
3926  *
3927  * \param[in] p_ctx pointer to session context
3928  * \param[in] eos_received (not used)
3929  *
3930  * \return NI_RETCODE_INVALID_PARAM
3931  * NI_RETCODE_ERROR_INVALID_SESSION
3932  * NI_RETCODE_ERROR_NVME_CMD_FAILED
3933  *******************************************************************************/
3934 ni_retcode_t ni_scaler_session_close(ni_session_context_t* p_ctx, int eos_received)
3935 {
3936  ni_retcode_t retval = NI_RETCODE_SUCCESS;
3937  void * p_buffer = NULL;
3938  uint32_t ui32LBA = 0;
3939 
3940  if (!p_ctx)
3941  {
3942  ni_log(NI_LOG_ERROR, "ERROR: %s() passed parameters are null!, return\n",
3943  __func__);
3944  return NI_RETCODE_INVALID_PARAM;
3945  }
3946 
3947  ni_pthread_mutex_lock(&p_ctx->mutex);
3948 
3949  if (p_ctx->session_id == NI_INVALID_SESSION_ID)
3950  {
3951  ni_log(NI_LOG_TRACE, "%s(): Invalid session ID, return.\n", __func__);
3952  retval = NI_RETCODE_SUCCESS;
3953  LRETURN;
3954  }
3955 
3956  //malloc data buffer
3957  if (ni_posix_memalign(&p_buffer, sysconf(_SC_PAGESIZE), NI_DATA_BUFFER_LEN))
3958  {
3959  ni_log(NI_LOG_ERROR, "ERROR %d: %s() malloc data buffer failed\n",
3960  NI_ERRNO, __func__);
3961  retval = NI_RETCODE_ERROR_MEM_ALOC;
3962  LRETURN;
3963  }
3964  memset(p_buffer, 0, NI_DATA_BUFFER_LEN);
3965 
3966  ui32LBA = CLOSE_SESSION_R(p_ctx->session_id, NI_DEVICE_TYPE_SCALER);
3967 
3968  int retry = 0;
3969  while (retry < NI_SESSION_CLOSE_RETRY_MAX)
3970  {
3971  ni_log(NI_LOG_DEBUG,
3972  "%s(): p_ctx->blk_io_handle=%" PRIx64 ", p_ctx->hw_id=%d, "
3973  "p_ctx->session_id=%d, close_mode=1\n",
3974  __func__, (int64_t)p_ctx->blk_io_handle, p_ctx->hw_id,
3975  p_ctx->session_id);
3976 
3977  if (ni_nvme_send_read_cmd(p_ctx->blk_io_handle, p_ctx->event_handle,
3978  p_buffer, NI_DATA_BUFFER_LEN, ui32LBA) < 0)
3979  {
3980  ni_log(NI_LOG_ERROR, "ERROR %s(): command failed!\n", __func__);
3981  retval = NI_RETCODE_ERROR_NVME_CMD_FAILED;
3982  break;
3983  } else
3984  {
3985  //Close should always succeed
3986  retval = NI_RETCODE_SUCCESS;
3987  p_ctx->session_id = NI_INVALID_SESSION_ID;
3988  break;
3989  }
3990  retry++;
3991  }
3992 
3993 #ifndef _WIN32
3994  if (p_ctx->isP2P)
3995  {
3996  if (p_ctx->netint_fd)
3997  {
3998  close(p_ctx->netint_fd);
3999  }
4000  }
4001 #endif
4002 
4003 END:
4004 
4005  ni_aligned_free(p_buffer);
4006  ni_aligned_free(p_ctx->p_all_zero_buf);
4007 
4008  ni_pthread_mutex_unlock(&p_ctx->mutex);
4009 
4010  return retval;
4011 }
4012 
4013 /*!******************************************************************************
4014  * \brief Send a p_config command to configure scaling parameters.
4015  *
4016  * \param ni_session_context_t p_ctx - xcoder Context
4017  * \param ni_scaler_params_t * params - pointer to the scaler ni_scaler_params_t struct
4018  *
4019  * \return - NI_RETCODE_SUCCESS on success, NI_RETCODE_ERROR_INVALID_SESSION, NI_RETCODE_ERROR_NVME_CMD_FAILED on failure
4020  *******************************************************************************/
4021 ni_retcode_t ni_config_instance_set_scaler_params(ni_session_context_t *p_ctx,
4022  ni_scaler_params_t *p_params)
4023 {
4024  void *p_scaler_config = NULL;
4025  ni_scaler_config_t *p_cfg = NULL;
4026  uint32_t buffer_size = sizeof(ni_scaler_params_t);
4027  ni_retcode_t retval = NI_RETCODE_SUCCESS;
4028  uint32_t ui32LBA = 0;
4029 
4030  ni_log(NI_LOG_TRACE, "%s(): enter\n", __func__);
4031 
4032  if (!p_ctx || !p_params)
4033  {
4034  ni_log(NI_LOG_ERROR, "ERROR: %s() passed parameters are null!, return\n",
4035  __func__);
4036  retval = NI_RETCODE_INVALID_PARAM;
4037  LRETURN;
4038  }
4039 
4040  if (NI_INVALID_SESSION_ID == p_ctx->session_id)
4041  {
4042  ni_log(NI_LOG_ERROR, "ERROR %s(): Invalid session ID, return.\n",
4043  __func__);
4044  retval = NI_RETCODE_ERROR_INVALID_SESSION;
4045  LRETURN;
4046  }
4047 
4048  buffer_size =
4049  ((buffer_size + (NI_MEM_PAGE_ALIGNMENT - 1)) / NI_MEM_PAGE_ALIGNMENT) *
4050  NI_MEM_PAGE_ALIGNMENT;
4051  if (ni_posix_memalign(&p_scaler_config, sysconf(_SC_PAGESIZE), buffer_size))
4052  {
4053  ni_log(NI_LOG_ERROR, "ERROR %d: %s() malloc p_scaler_config buffer failed\n",
4054  NI_ERRNO, __func__);
4055  retval = NI_RETCODE_ERROR_MEM_ALOC;
4056  LRETURN;
4057  }
4058  memset(p_scaler_config, 0, buffer_size);
4059 
4060  //configure the session here
4061  ui32LBA = CONFIG_INSTANCE_SetScalerPara_W(p_ctx->session_id,
4062  NI_DEVICE_TYPE_SCALER);
4063 
4064  //Flip the bytes!!
4065  p_cfg = (ni_scaler_config_t *)p_scaler_config;
4066  p_cfg->filterblit = p_params->filterblit;
4067  p_cfg->numInputs = p_params->nb_inputs;
4068 
4069  if (ni_nvme_send_write_cmd(p_ctx->blk_io_handle, p_ctx->event_handle,
4070  p_scaler_config, buffer_size, ui32LBA) < 0)
4071  {
4072  ni_log(NI_LOG_ERROR,
4073  "ERROR: ni_nvme_send_write_cmd failed: blk_io_handle: %" PRIx64
4074  ", hw_id, %d, xcoder_inst_id: %d\n",
4075  (int64_t)p_ctx->blk_io_handle, p_ctx->hw_id, p_ctx->session_id);
4076  // Close the session since we can't configure it as per fw
4077  retval = ni_scaler_session_close(p_ctx, 0);
4078  if (NI_RETCODE_SUCCESS != retval)
4079  {
4080  ni_log(NI_LOG_ERROR,
4081  "ERROR: %s failed: blk_io_handle: %" PRIx64 ","
4082  "hw_id, %d, xcoder_inst_id: %d\n",
4083  (int64_t)p_ctx->blk_io_handle, p_ctx->hw_id,
4084  p_ctx->session_id);
4085  }
4086 
4087  retval = NI_RETCODE_ERROR_NVME_CMD_FAILED;
4088  }
4089 
4090 END:
4091 
4092  ni_aligned_free(p_scaler_config);
4093  ni_log(NI_LOG_TRACE, "%s(): exit\n", __func__);
4094 
4095  return retval;
4096 }
4097 
4098 /*!******************************************************************************
4099  * \brief allocate a frame in the scaler
4100  *
4101  * \param[in] p_ctx pointer to session context
4102  * \param[in] width width in pixels
4103  * \param[in] height height in pixels
4104  * \param[in] format pixel format
4105  * \param[in] options option flags
4106  * \param[in] rectangle_width clipping rectangle width in pixels
4107  * \param[in] rectangle_height clipping rectangle height in pixels
4108  * \param[in] rectangle_x clipping rectangle x position
4109  * \param[in] rectangle_y clipping rectangle y position
4110  * \param[in] rgba_color background colour (only used by pad filter)
4111  * \param[in] frame_index frame index (only for hardware frames)
4112  *
4113  * \return NI_RETCODE_INVALID_PARAM
4114  * NI_RETCODE_ERROR_INVALID_SESSION
4115  * NI_RETCODE_ERROR_NVME_CMD_FAILED
4116  * NI_RETCODE_ERROR_MEM_ALOC
4117  *******************************************************************************/
4118 ni_retcode_t ni_scaler_alloc_frame(ni_session_context_t* p_ctx,
4119  int width,
4120  int height,
4121  int format,
4122  int options,
4123  int rectangle_width,
4124  int rectangle_height,
4125  int rectangle_x,
4126  int rectangle_y,
4127  int rgba_color,
4128  int frame_index)
4129 {
4130  ni_retcode_t retval = NI_RETCODE_SUCCESS;
4131  ni_instance_mgr_allocation_info_t *p_data;
4132  uint32_t dataLen;
4133  uint32_t ui32LBA = 0;
4134 
4135  /* Round up to nearest 4096 bytes */
4136  dataLen =
4137  sizeof(ni_instance_mgr_allocation_info_t) + NI_MEM_PAGE_ALIGNMENT - 1;
4138  dataLen = dataLen & 0xFFFFF000;
4139 
4140  if (!p_ctx)
4141  {
4142  return NI_RETCODE_INVALID_PARAM;
4143  }
4144 
4145  if (p_ctx->session_id == NI_INVALID_SESSION_ID)
4146  {
4147  ni_log(NI_LOG_ERROR, "ERROR %s(): Invalid session ID, return.\n",
4148  __func__);
4149  return NI_RETCODE_ERROR_INVALID_SESSION;
4150  }
4151 
4152  if (ni_posix_memalign((void **)&p_data, sysconf(_SC_PAGESIZE), dataLen))
4153  {
4154  ni_log(NI_LOG_ERROR, "ERROR %d: %s() Cannot allocate buffer\n",
4155  NI_ERRNO, __func__);
4156  return NI_RETCODE_ERROR_MEM_ALOC;
4157  }
4158 
4159  memset(p_data, 0x00, dataLen);
4160 
4161  p_data->picture_width = width;
4162  p_data->picture_height = height;
4163  p_data->picture_format = format;
4164  p_data->options = options;
4165  p_data->rectangle_width = rectangle_width;
4166  p_data->rectangle_height = rectangle_height;
4167  p_data->rectangle_x = rectangle_x;
4168  p_data->rectangle_y = rectangle_y;
4169  p_data->rgba_color = rgba_color;
4170  p_data->frame_index = frame_index;
4171 
4172  ni_log(NI_LOG_DEBUG,
4173  "Dev alloc frame: W=%d; H=%d; C=%d; RW=%d; RH=%d; RX=%d; RY=%d\n",
4174  p_data->picture_width, p_data->picture_height,
4175  p_data->picture_format, p_data->rectangle_width,
4176  p_data->rectangle_height, p_data->rectangle_x, p_data->rectangle_y);
4177  ui32LBA = CONFIG_INSTANCE_SetScalerAlloc_W(p_ctx->session_id,
4178  NI_DEVICE_TYPE_SCALER);
4179 
4180  retval = ni_nvme_send_write_cmd(p_ctx->blk_io_handle, p_ctx->event_handle,
4181  p_data, dataLen, ui32LBA);
4182  CHECK_ERR_RC(p_ctx, retval, nvme_admin_cmd_xcoder_config,
4183  p_ctx->device_type, p_ctx->hw_id, &(p_ctx->session_id));
4184  if (NI_RETCODE_SUCCESS != retval)
4185  {
4186  ni_log(NI_LOG_ERROR,
4187  "ERROR: ni_nvme_send_admin_cmd failed: "
4188  "blk_io_handle: %" PRIx64 ", hw_id, %u, xcoder_inst_id: %d\n",
4189  (int64_t)p_ctx->blk_io_handle, p_ctx->hw_id, p_ctx->session_id);
4190  ni_log(NI_LOG_ERROR, "ERROR %s(): nvme command failed!\n", __func__);
4191  retval = NI_RETCODE_ERROR_NVME_CMD_FAILED;
4192  }
4193 
4194 // cppcheck-suppress unusedLabel
4195 END:
4196 
4197  ni_aligned_free(p_data);
4198  return retval;
4199 }
4200 
4201 /*!******************************************************************************
4202  * \brief config a frame in the scaler
4203  *
4204  * \param[in] p_ctx pointer to session context
4205  * \param[in] p_cfg pointer to frame config
4206  *
4207  * \return NI_RETCODE_INVALID_PARAM
4208  * NI_RETCODE_ERROR_INVALID_SESSION
4209  * NI_RETCODE_ERROR_NVME_CMD_FAILED
4210  * NI_RETCODE_ERROR_MEM_ALOC
4211  *******************************************************************************/
4212 ni_retcode_t ni_scaler_config_frame(ni_session_context_t *p_ctx,
4213  ni_frame_config_t *p_cfg)
4214 {
4215  ni_retcode_t retval = NI_RETCODE_SUCCESS;
4216  ni_instance_mgr_allocation_info_t *p_data;
4217  uint32_t dataLen;
4218  uint32_t ui32LBA = 0;
4219 
4220  /* Round up to nearest 4096 bytes */
4221  dataLen =
4222  sizeof(ni_instance_mgr_allocation_info_t) + NI_MEM_PAGE_ALIGNMENT - 1;
4223  dataLen = dataLen & 0xFFFFF000;
4224 
4225  if (!p_ctx || !p_cfg)
4226  {
4227  return NI_RETCODE_INVALID_PARAM;
4228  }
4229 
4230  if (p_ctx->session_id == NI_INVALID_SESSION_ID)
4231  {
4232  ni_log(NI_LOG_ERROR, "ERROR %s(): Invalid session ID, return.\n",
4233  __func__);
4234  return NI_RETCODE_ERROR_INVALID_SESSION;
4235  }
4236 
4237  if (ni_posix_memalign((void **)&p_data, sysconf(_SC_PAGESIZE), dataLen))
4238  {
4239  ni_log(NI_LOG_ERROR, "ERROR %d: %s() Cannot allocate buffer\n",
4240  NI_ERRNO, __func__);
4241  return NI_RETCODE_ERROR_MEM_ALOC;
4242  }
4243 
4244  memset(p_data, 0x00, dataLen);
4245 
4246  p_data->picture_width = p_cfg->picture_width;
4247  p_data->picture_height = p_cfg->picture_height;
4248  p_data->picture_format = p_cfg->picture_format;
4249  p_data->options = p_cfg->options;
4250 
4251  p_data->rectangle_width = p_cfg->rectangle_width;
4252  p_data->rectangle_height = p_cfg->rectangle_height;
4253  p_data->rectangle_x = p_cfg->rectangle_x;
4254  p_data->rectangle_y = p_cfg->rectangle_y;
4255  p_data->rgba_color = p_cfg->rgba_color;
4256  p_data->frame_index = p_cfg->frame_index;
4257  p_data->session_id = p_cfg->session_id;
4258  p_data->output_index = p_cfg->output_index;
4259  switch (p_cfg->orientation)
4260  {
4261  case 0:
4262  case 2:
4263  p_data->orientation = p_cfg->orientation;
4264  break;
4265  case 1:
4266  p_data->orientation = 3;
4267  break;
4268  case 3:
4269  p_data->orientation = 1;
4270  break;
4271  default:
4272  ni_log(NI_LOG_ERROR, "Bad orientation: %u\n", p_cfg->orientation);
4273  return NI_RETCODE_PARAM_INVALID_VALUE;
4274  }
4275 
4276  ni_log(NI_LOG_DEBUG,
4277  "Dev config frame: W=%d; H=%d; C=%d; RW=%d; RH=%d; RX=%d; RY=%d; O=%d\n",
4278  p_data->picture_width, p_data->picture_height,
4279  p_data->picture_format, p_data->rectangle_width,
4280  p_data->rectangle_height, p_data->rectangle_x,
4281  p_data->rectangle_y, p_data->orientation);
4282 
4283  ui32LBA = CONFIG_INSTANCE_SetScalerAlloc_W(p_ctx->session_id,
4284  NI_DEVICE_TYPE_SCALER);
4285 
4286  retval = ni_nvme_send_write_cmd(p_ctx->blk_io_handle, p_ctx->event_handle,
4287  p_data, dataLen, ui32LBA);
4288  CHECK_ERR_RC(p_ctx, retval, nvme_admin_cmd_xcoder_config,
4289  p_ctx->device_type, p_ctx->hw_id, &(p_ctx->session_id));
4290  if (NI_RETCODE_SUCCESS != retval)
4291  {
4292  ni_log(NI_LOG_ERROR,
4293  "ERROR: ni_nvme_send_admin_cmd failed: blk_io_handle: %" PRIx64
4294  ", hw_id, %u, xcoder_inst_id: %d\n",
4295  (int64_t)p_ctx->blk_io_handle, p_ctx->hw_id, p_ctx->session_id);
4296 
4297  ni_log(NI_LOG_ERROR,
4298  "ERROR ni_scaler_config(): nvme command failed!\n");
4299  retval = NI_RETCODE_ERROR_NVME_CMD_FAILED;
4300  }
4301 
4302 // cppcheck-suppress unusedLabel
4303 END:
4304 
4305  ni_aligned_free(p_data);
4306  return retval;
4307 }
4308 
4309 /*!******************************************************************************
4310  * \brief config multiple frames in the scaler
4311  *
4312  * \param[in] p_ctx pointer to session context
4313  * \param[in] p_cfg_in pointer to input frame config array
4314  * \param[in] numInCfgs number of input frame configs in the p_cfg array
4315  * \param[in] p_cfg_out pointer to output frame config
4316  *
4317  * \return NI_RETCODE_INVALID_PARAM
4318  * NI_RETCODE_ERROR_INVALID_SESSION
4319  * NI_RETCODE_ERROR_NVME_CMD_FAILED
4320  * NI_RETCODE_ERROR_MEM_ALOC
4321  *******************************************************************************/
4322 ni_retcode_t ni_scaler_multi_config_frame(ni_session_context_t *p_ctx,
4323  ni_frame_config_t p_cfg_in[],
4324  int numInCfgs,
4325  ni_frame_config_t *p_cfg_out)
4326 {
4327  ni_retcode_t retval = NI_RETCODE_SUCCESS;
4328  ni_instance_mgr_allocation_info_t *p_data, *p_data_orig;
4329  uint32_t dataLen;
4330  uint32_t ui32LBA = 0;
4331  int i;
4332 
4333  /* Round up to nearest 4096 bytes */
4334  dataLen =
4335  sizeof(ni_instance_mgr_allocation_info_t) * (numInCfgs + 1) + NI_MEM_PAGE_ALIGNMENT - 1;
4336  dataLen = dataLen & 0xFFFFF000;
4337 
4338  if (!p_ctx || (!p_cfg_in && numInCfgs))
4339  {
4340  return NI_RETCODE_INVALID_PARAM;
4341  }
4342 
4343  if (p_ctx->session_id == NI_INVALID_SESSION_ID)
4344  {
4345  ni_log(NI_LOG_ERROR, "ERROR %s(): Invalid session ID, return.\n",
4346  __func__);
4347  return NI_RETCODE_ERROR_INVALID_SESSION;
4348  }
4349 
4350  if (ni_posix_memalign((void **)&p_data, sysconf(_SC_PAGESIZE), dataLen))
4351  {
4352  ni_log(NI_LOG_ERROR, "ERROR %d: %s() Cannot allocate buffer\n",
4353  NI_ERRNO, __func__);
4354  return NI_RETCODE_ERROR_MEM_ALOC;
4355  }
4356 
4357  memset(p_data, 0x00, dataLen);
4358 
4359  p_data_orig = p_data;
4360 
4361  for (i = 0; i < numInCfgs; i++)
4362  {
4363  p_data->picture_width = p_cfg_in[i].picture_width;
4364  p_data->picture_height = p_cfg_in[i].picture_height;
4365  p_data->picture_format = p_cfg_in[i].picture_format;
4366  p_data->options = p_cfg_in[i].options & ~NI_SCALER_FLAG_IO;
4367 
4368  p_data->rectangle_width = p_cfg_in[i].rectangle_width;
4369  p_data->rectangle_height = p_cfg_in[i].rectangle_height;
4370  p_data->rectangle_x = p_cfg_in[i].rectangle_x;
4371  p_data->rectangle_y = p_cfg_in[i].rectangle_y;
4372  p_data->rgba_color = p_cfg_in[i].rgba_color;
4373  p_data->frame_index = p_cfg_in[i].frame_index;
4374  p_data->session_id = p_cfg_in[i].session_id;
4375  p_data->output_index = p_cfg_in[i].output_index;
4376 
4377  ni_log(NI_LOG_DEBUG,
4378  "Dev in config frame %d: W=%d; H=%d; C=%d; RW=%d; RH=%d; RX=%d; RY=%d\n",
4379  i, p_data->picture_width, p_data->picture_height,
4380  p_data->picture_format, p_data->rectangle_width,
4381  p_data->rectangle_height, p_data->rectangle_x, p_data->rectangle_y);
4382 
4383  p_data++;
4384  }
4385 
4386  if (p_cfg_out)
4387  {
4388  p_data->picture_width = p_cfg_out->picture_width;
4389  p_data->picture_height = p_cfg_out->picture_height;
4390  p_data->picture_format = p_cfg_out->picture_format;
4391  p_data->options = p_cfg_out->options | NI_SCALER_FLAG_IO;
4392 
4393  p_data->rectangle_width = p_cfg_out->rectangle_width;
4394  p_data->rectangle_height = p_cfg_out->rectangle_height;
4395  p_data->rectangle_x = p_cfg_out->rectangle_x;
4396  p_data->rectangle_y = p_cfg_out->rectangle_y;
4397  p_data->rgba_color = p_cfg_out->rgba_color;
4398  p_data->frame_index = p_cfg_out->frame_index;
4399 
4400  ni_log(NI_LOG_DEBUG,
4401  "Dev out config frame: W=%d; H=%d; C=%d; RW=%d; RH=%d; RX=%d; RY=%d\n",
4402  p_data->picture_width, p_data->picture_height,
4403  p_data->picture_format, p_data->rectangle_width,
4404  p_data->rectangle_height, p_data->rectangle_x,
4405  p_data->rectangle_y);
4406  }
4407 
4408  ui32LBA = CONFIG_INSTANCE_SetScalerAlloc_W(p_ctx->session_id,
4409  NI_DEVICE_TYPE_SCALER);
4410 
4411  retval = ni_nvme_send_write_cmd(p_ctx->blk_io_handle, p_ctx->event_handle,
4412  p_data_orig, dataLen, ui32LBA);
4413  CHECK_ERR_RC(p_ctx, retval, nvme_admin_cmd_xcoder_config,
4414  p_ctx->device_type, p_ctx->hw_id, &(p_ctx->session_id));
4415  if (NI_RETCODE_SUCCESS != retval)
4416  {
4417  ni_log(NI_LOG_ERROR,
4418  "ERROR: ni_nvme_send_admin_cmd failed: blk_io_handle: %" PRIx64
4419  ", hw_id, %u, xcoder_inst_id: %d\n",
4420  (int64_t)p_ctx->blk_io_handle, p_ctx->hw_id, p_ctx->session_id);
4421 
4422  ni_log(NI_LOG_ERROR,
4423  "ERROR ni_scaler_config(): nvme command failed!\n");
4424  retval = NI_RETCODE_ERROR_NVME_CMD_FAILED;
4425  }
4426 
4427 // cppcheck-suppress unusedLabel
4428 END:
4429 
4430  ni_aligned_free(p_data_orig);
4431  return retval;
4432 }
4433 
4434 /*!******************************************************************************
4435  * \brief Query a particular xcoder instance to get GeneralStatus data
4436  *
4437  * \param ni_session_context_t p_ctx - xcoder Context
4438  * \param ni_device_type_t device_type - xcoder type Encoder or Decoder
4439  * \param ni_instance_mgr_general_status_t *out - Struct preallocated from the caller where the
4440  * resulting data will be placed
4441  *
4442  * \return - NI_RETCODE_SUCCESS on success, NI_RETCODE_ERROR_MEM_ALOC or NI_RETCODE_ERROR_NVME_CMD_FAILED on failure
4443  *******************************************************************************/
4444 int ni_query_general_status(ni_session_context_t* p_ctx, ni_device_type_t device_type, ni_instance_mgr_general_status_t* p_gen_status)
4445 {
4446  void* p_buffer = NULL;
4447  int retval = NI_RETCODE_SUCCESS;
4448  uint32_t ui32LBA = 0;
4449  uint32_t dataLen = ((sizeof(ni_instance_mgr_general_status_t) + (NI_MEM_PAGE_ALIGNMENT - 1)) / NI_MEM_PAGE_ALIGNMENT) * NI_MEM_PAGE_ALIGNMENT;
4450 
4451  ni_log(NI_LOG_TRACE, "%s(): enter\n", __func__);
4452 
4453  if ((!p_ctx) || (!p_gen_status))
4454  {
4455  ni_log(NI_LOG_ERROR, "ERROR: %s() passed parameters are null!, return\n",
4456  __func__);
4457  retval = NI_RETCODE_INVALID_PARAM;
4458  LRETURN;
4459  }
4460 
4461  if (!IS_XCODER_DEVICE_TYPE(device_type))
4462  {
4463  ni_log(NI_LOG_ERROR, "ERROR: %s() Unknown device type %d, return\n",
4464  __func__, device_type);
4465  retval = NI_RETCODE_INVALID_PARAM;
4466  LRETURN;
4467  }
4468 
4469  ui32LBA = QUERY_GENERAL_GET_STATUS_R(device_type);
4470 
4471  if (ni_posix_memalign((void **)&p_buffer, sysconf(_SC_PAGESIZE), dataLen))
4472  {
4473  ni_log(NI_LOG_ERROR, "ERROR %d: %s() Cannot allocate buffer\n",
4474  NI_ERRNO, __func__);
4475  retval = NI_RETCODE_ERROR_MEM_ALOC;
4476  LRETURN;
4477  }
4478 
4479  memset(p_buffer, 0, dataLen);
4480 
4481  if (ni_nvme_send_read_cmd(p_ctx->blk_io_handle, p_ctx->event_handle, p_buffer, dataLen, ui32LBA) < 0)
4482  {
4483  ni_log(NI_LOG_ERROR, "%s(): NVME command Failed\n", __func__);
4484  retval = NI_RETCODE_ERROR_NVME_CMD_FAILED;
4485  LRETURN;
4486  }
4487 
4488  //No need to flip the bytes since the datastruct has only uint8_t datatypes
4489  memcpy((void*)p_gen_status, p_buffer, sizeof(ni_instance_mgr_general_status_t));
4490 
4491  ni_log(NI_LOG_DEBUG, "%s(): model_load:%u qc:%d percent:%d\n", __func__,
4492  p_gen_status->fw_model_load, p_gen_status->cmd_queue_count,
4493  p_gen_status->process_load_percent);
4494 END:
4495 
4496  ni_aligned_free(p_buffer);
4497  ni_log(NI_LOG_TRACE, "%s(): exit\n", __func__);
4498 
4499  return retval;
4500 }
4501 
4502 /*!******************************************************************************
4503  * \brief Query a particular xcoder instance to get Stream Info data
4504  *
4505  * \param ni_session_context_t p_ctx - xcoder Context
4506  * \param ni_device_type_t device_type - xcoder type Encoder or Decoder
4507  * \param ni_instance_mgr_stream_info_t *out - Struct preallocated from the caller where the
4508  * resulting data will be placed
4509  *
4510  * \return - NI_RETCODE_SUCCESS on success, NI_RETCODE_ERROR_INVALID_SESSION, NI_RETCODE_ERROR_MEM_ALOC
4511  * or NI_RETCODE_ERROR_NVME_CMD_FAILED on failure
4512  *******************************************************************************/
4513 ni_retcode_t ni_query_stream_info(ni_session_context_t* p_ctx, ni_device_type_t device_type, ni_instance_mgr_stream_info_t* p_stream_info)
4514 {
4515  void* p_buffer = NULL;
4516  ni_retcode_t retval = NI_RETCODE_SUCCESS;
4517  uint32_t ui32LBA = 0;
4518  uint32_t dataLen = ((sizeof(ni_instance_mgr_stream_info_t) + (NI_MEM_PAGE_ALIGNMENT - 1)) / NI_MEM_PAGE_ALIGNMENT) * NI_MEM_PAGE_ALIGNMENT;
4519 
4520  ni_log(NI_LOG_TRACE, "%s(): enter\n", __func__);
4521 
4522  if ((!p_ctx) || (!p_stream_info))
4523  {
4524  ni_log(NI_LOG_ERROR, "ERROR: %s() passed parameters are null!, return\n",
4525  __func__);
4526  retval = NI_RETCODE_INVALID_PARAM;
4527  LRETURN;
4528  }
4529 
4530  if (! (NI_DEVICE_TYPE_DECODER == device_type ||
4531  NI_DEVICE_TYPE_ENCODER == device_type))
4532  {
4533  ni_log(NI_LOG_ERROR, "ERROR: %s() Unknown device type %d, return\n",
4534  __func__, device_type);
4535  retval = NI_RETCODE_INVALID_PARAM;
4536  LRETURN;
4537  }
4538 
4539  if (NI_INVALID_SESSION_ID == p_ctx->session_id)
4540  {
4541  ni_log(NI_LOG_ERROR, "ERROR %s(): Invalid session ID, return.\n",
4542  __func__);
4543  retval = NI_RETCODE_ERROR_INVALID_SESSION;
4544  LRETURN;
4545  }
4546 
4547  ui32LBA = QUERY_INSTANCE_STREAM_INFO_R(p_ctx->session_id, device_type);
4548 
4549  if (ni_posix_memalign(&p_buffer, sysconf(_SC_PAGESIZE), dataLen))
4550  {
4551  ni_log(NI_LOG_ERROR, "ERROR %d: %s() Cannot allocate buffer\n",
4552  NI_ERRNO, __func__);
4553  retval = NI_RETCODE_ERROR_MEM_ALOC;
4554  LRETURN;
4555  }
4556  memset(p_buffer, 0, dataLen);
4557 
4558  if (ni_nvme_send_read_cmd(p_ctx->blk_io_handle, p_ctx->event_handle, p_buffer, dataLen, ui32LBA) < 0)
4559  {
4560  ni_log(NI_LOG_ERROR, "%s(): NVME command Failed\n", __func__);
4561  retval = NI_RETCODE_ERROR_NVME_CMD_FAILED;
4562  LRETURN;
4563  }
4564 
4565  memcpy((void*)p_stream_info, p_buffer, sizeof(ni_instance_mgr_stream_info_t));
4566 
4567  //flip the bytes to host order
4568  p_stream_info->picture_width = ni_htons(p_stream_info->picture_width);
4569  p_stream_info->picture_height = ni_htons(p_stream_info->picture_height);
4570  p_stream_info->frame_rate = ni_htons(p_stream_info->frame_rate);
4571  p_stream_info->is_flushed = ni_htons(p_stream_info->is_flushed);
4572  p_stream_info->transfer_frame_stride = ni_htons(p_stream_info->transfer_frame_stride);
4573  ni_log(NI_LOG_DEBUG, "%s(): pix_format = %d\n", __func__,
4574  p_stream_info->pix_format); //temp
4575 
4576 END:
4577 
4578  ni_aligned_free(p_buffer);
4579  ni_log(NI_LOG_TRACE, "%s(): exit\n", __func__);
4580 
4581  return retval;
4582 }
4583 
4584 /*!*****************************************************************************
